translated: the vajra, the trident, the discus, the sakti, the club, the unequalled weapons he hurled, together with the assembly of mātṛs and the assembly of bhūtas.🔽He manifested various forms without end or middle,

original: bdud dang / bgegs byed pa dang / mtha' dang / mu med pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su sprul /
analyzed: bdud dang / bgegs byed pa dang / mtha' dang / mu med pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su sprul /

analyzed: khro bo rab tu mi bzad pa ma rungs pa'i tshogs chen po dang lhan cig tu rab tu 'thab cing shin tu 'gyed pa /

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan mo'i mun nag tu byas /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan mo'i mun nag tu byas /

analyzed: 'bar ba chen po'i phung pos klongs te rab tu snang bar byas so //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba chen po cung zad du mche ba'i thog ma gtsigs pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba chen po cung zad du mche ba'i thog ma gtsigs pa /

original: smin ma'i mtshams kyi khro gnyer gyi rlabs bskyod pa /
analyzed: smin ma'i mtshams kyi khro gnyer gyi rlabs bskyod pa /

original: mig g-yon pa cher bgrad de /
analyzed: mig g-yon pa cher bgrad de /
translated: and greatly opened his left eye.

original: rdo rje'i lta ba khro ba dang bcas pas zab mo'i tshig gis snying po mchog 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dpal zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lta ba khro ba dang bcas pas zab mo'i tshig gis snying po mchog 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dpal zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: With a vajra gaze and wrath, he spoke these profound words, the essence of the glorious victory over the three worlds, called The Supreme One.

original: h'um/ de nas h'um zhes bya ba des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun sgra des gang nas /
analyzed: h'um/ de nas h'um zhes bya ba des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun sgra des gang nas /

original: g-yos / rab tu g-yos /
analyzed: g-yos / rab tu g-yos /
translated: shaking, greatly shaking,

original: kun tu rab tu g-yos so //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu g-yos so //
translated: and shook in every way.

original: 'khrol / rab tu 'khrol /
analyzed: 'khrol / rab tu 'khrol /

original: kun tu rab tu 'khrol lo //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'khrol lo //
translated: it resounded everywhere.

original: de nas dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa lha'i tshogs thams cad bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa lha'i tshogs thams cad bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then all the hosts of gods, headed by Maheśvara,

original: bskyab tu gsol /
analyzed: bskyab tu gsol /
translated: pleaded with the Blessed One:

original: bde @18a *// bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde @18a *// bar gshegs pa /

original: bskyab tu gsol zhes nas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su dong ngo //
analyzed: bskyab tu gsol zhes nas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su dong ngo //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Vajrapāṇi:

analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i sngags kyi tshig smra ba ni khyod rab tu mi bgrungs so //

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag btsal nas /

original: yang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba 'di gsungs so //

original: aom sumbha ni su mbha h'um/
analyzed: aom sumbha ni su mbha h'um/
translated: Oṃ, suṃbha ni suṃbha hūṃ🔽grihṇa grihṇa hūṃ

original: grihna grihna h'um/ grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ye h'um/
analyzed: grihna grihna h'um/ grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ye h'um/
translated: grihṇāpaya grihṇāpaya hūṃ

original: a'a na ya ho bha ga b'na badzra h'um phat/
analyzed: a'a na ya ho bha ga b'na badzra h'um phat/
translated: ānayaho bhagavān vajra hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis lha chen po la sogs pa lha'i bdag po thams cad 'khor dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje gang na ba der mgo rkang bzlos ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis lha chen po la sogs pa lha'i bdag po thams cad 'khor dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje gang na ba der mgo rkang bzlos ste /
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the lords of the gods, such as Maheśvara, together with their retinues, went to where the bhagavān Vajrapāṇi was, bowing their heads and feet.

original: ri rab ri'i rtse mo'i dkyil 'khor chen por btsud nas brlams par byas te /
analyzed: ri rab ri'i rtse mo'i dkyil 'khor chen por btsud nas brlams par byas te /
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the lords of the gods, including Maheśvara, together with their retinues, were brought by the Blessed Vajrapāṇi to the great maṇḍala on the peak of Mount Sumeru, and were possessed.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs g-yon pas mnan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs g-yon pas mnan to //
translated: They were trampled under the left foot of the Blessed Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /

original: phyag na rdo rje khyod kyis 'di 'dra bar sems can 'dul bar byed pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje khyod kyis 'di 'dra bar sems can 'dul bar byed pa legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, Vajrapāṇi, that you tame beings in this way!

original: de bas na thul la dbugs phyungs shig /
analyzed: de bas na thul la dbugs phyungs shig /
translated: Therefore, tame them and give them relief!”

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de dag gi don gyi phyir rdo rjes bcings pa @18b 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de dag gi don gyi phyir rdo rjes bcings pa @18b 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi, for their sake, spoke this vajra binding:

original: aom badzra di dho me bha ba raksha sarba n'a sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom badzra di dho me bha ba raksha sarba n'a sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra dīdhimo me bhavā rakṣa sarva nāḥ svāhā.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis lha chen po la sogs pa de dag dran pa rnyed do //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis lha chen po la sogs pa de dag dran pa rnyed do //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to them,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: sems can chen po 'di'i bka' bzhin du byed par khas long zhig /
analyzed: sems can chen po 'di'i bka' bzhin du byed par khas long zhig /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la de dag thams cad mgrin gcig tu bdag cag mchid kyis 'tshal lo zhes gsol to //
translated: Then all of them said with one voice to the Blessed One, “We promise.”

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang rang gi snying po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang rang gi snying po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi again uttered his essence mantra:

original: h'um takki ho //
analyzed: h'um takki ho //
translated: Hūṃ takki ho.

original: de nas 'di brjod pa tsam gyis lha la sogs pa thams cad dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de nas 'di brjod pa tsam gyis lha la sogs pa thams cad dbang du byas te /
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the gods and so forth were brought under control.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la phyag byas nas mchi ma blags te ngo ro bton nas skyabs su dong ste; bcom ldan 'das bskyab tu gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la phyag byas nas mchi ma blags te ngo ro bton nas skyabs su dong ste; bcom ldan 'das bskyab tu gsol /
translated: They bowed to the Lord Vajrapāṇi, shed tears, wept, and went for refuge, saying, “Blessed One, please protect us!

original: nga bdag cag khyod kyi bka' nyan na ci ltar bgyi ba bka' stsal du gsol zhes so //
analyzed: nga bdag cag khyod kyi bka' nyan na ci ltar bgyi ba bka' stsal du gsol zhes so //
translated: If we are to be your disciples, please tell us what to do.”

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de rnams la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de rnams la gsungs pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi said to them,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang / sdom pa gzung bar khas longs shig /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang / sdom pa gzung bar khas longs shig /
translated: take up the mind of awakening and the vows.”

original: de dag gis gsol ba /
analyzed: de dag gis gsol ba /
translated: They said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing byang chub tu 'ang sems bskyed par 'tshal lo // de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems @19a *//
translated: we wish to serve the blessed buddhas and arouse the mind of awakening.”

original: dpa' chen pos yang de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor du btsud nas sdom pa 'dzin du bcug ste /
analyzed: dpa' chen pos yang de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor du btsud nas sdom pa 'dzin du bcug ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi again initiated them into the maṇḍala in the proper way and had them take the vows.

original: byang chub sems ni brtan byas pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni brtan byas pa //
translated: Having stabilized the mind of awakening,

original: sems can thams cad bde ba stsal //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde ba stsal //
translated: grant happiness to all sentient beings.🔽Do not disparage the great being Vajrapāṇi

original: phyag na rdo rje bdag chen dang // 'dod pa smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje bdag chen dang // 'dod pa smad par mi bya'o //
translated: and desire.

original: 'di ni gsang ba pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsang ba pa yin no //
translated: This is the secret.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag sdom pa 'dzin du bcug nas dam tshig byin pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag sdom pa 'dzin du bcug nas dam tshig byin pa ni /
translated: Then the Blessed One made them take the vows and gave them the commitments:

original: aom badzra sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa m'a bi r'a ga ye sarba k'a m'an h'um phat/
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa m'a bi r'a ga ye sarba k'a m'an h'um phat/

original: de nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: Then they said,

original: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pas na bdag cag mi nyan to //
analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pas na bdag cag mi nyan to //
translated: “This was spoken by Māra, so we will not listen.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la khyed cag gis 'di la ma brnyas shig ces gsungs pa dang / de dag gis gsol ba ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la khyed cag gis 'di la ma brnyas shig ces gsungs pa dang / de dag gis gsol ba ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, said to them, “Do not disparage this,” and they said, “As the Blessed One himself has said, ‘Freedom from desire is the awakening of the buddhas.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: kye grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag /
translated: “O friends,

original: nga ni ji ltar 'dul bzhin du byed pa ste /
analyzed: nga ni ji ltar 'dul bzhin du byed pa ste /
translated: I do as I am disciplined.

original: 'di nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di sun 'byin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di sun 'byin te /
translated: By this very [practice], I will destroy this world.

original: ji ltar bde ba la mi chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la 'dod chags pa can ji lta bus 'jig rten 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'chad par mdzad de /
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba la mi chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la 'dod chags pa can ji lta bus 'jig rten 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'chad par mdzad de /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma in whatever way the world is to be disciplined, by whatever kind of non-attachment to pleasure and attachment to suffering.

original: de dag sbyang ba'i phyir 'di ni de bzhin @19b gshegs pa thams cad kun tu bzang po byang chub sems dpas ci nas kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar ma byed cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de dag sbyang ba'i phyir 'di ni de bzhin @19b gshegs pa thams cad kun tu bzang po byang chub sems dpas ci nas kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar ma byed cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: For the sake of purifying those, the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra of all the Tathagatas says, 'Do not become free from desire in any way.'

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes yang gsungs pa /
translated: Then Vajrapani spoke again:

original: aom badrza sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa mi bi r'a ga ya sarba k'a m'am h'um phat/
analyzed: aom badrza sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa mi bi r'a ga ya sarba k'a m'am h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ, Bhadraya, Samaya, Abhisincāmi, Viragya, Sarvakāmān, Hūṃ Phaṭ.

original: de nas de dag gis ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba bzhin no zhes gsol to //
analyzed: de nas de dag gis ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba bzhin no zhes gsol to //
translated: Then they said, As the Blessed One has said.

original: de nas yang phyag na rdo rjes lag tu rdo rje byin te /
analyzed: de nas yang phyag na rdo rjes lag tu rdo rje byin te /
translated: Then Vajrapani gave the vajra into his hand and said,🔽Oṃ, Vajra, Āḥ.

original: rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba 'di byin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba 'di byin no //
translated: This is the bestowal of the vajra empowerment.

original: aom badzra aa bhi shinytsa sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dha ro ttve badzra p'a ni h'i /
analyzed: aom badzra aa bhi shinytsa sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dha ro ttve badzra p'a ni h'i /
translated: Oṃ vajra-abhiṣiñca sarva-tathāgata vajra-dhara-tve vajrapāṇi hīḥ.

original: ha ha ha ha /
analyzed: ha ha ha ha /
translated: Ha ha ha ha.

original: de nas rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽dbang phyug chen po ni rdo rje rig sngags mchog go /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni 'di lta ste / dbang phyug chen po ni rdo rje rig sngags mchog go /
translated: Then the bestowal of the vajra name empowerment is as follows:🔽Maheśvara is Vajra-vidyā-uttama.

original: mthu bo che ni rdo rje sgyu ma'o //🔽tshangs pa ni rdo rje mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: mthu bo che ni rdo rje sgyu ma'o // tshangs pa ni rdo rje mi smra ba'o //
translated: Mahodara is Vajra-māyā.🔽Brahmā is Vajra-tūṣṇīka.

original: sgra gzhon nu ni rdo rje dril bu'o //
analyzed: sgra gzhon nu ni rdo rje dril bu'o //
translated: Nārada is Vajra-ghaṇṭa.

original: dbang po ni rdo rje 'thab cha ste /
analyzed: dbang po ni rdo rje 'thab cha ste /
translated: Indra is Vajra-yuddha.

original: de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang po thams cad rig pa'i blon po chen por dbang bskur ro //🔽de nas bar snang la rgyu ba rnams rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang po thams cad rig pa'i blon po chen por dbang bskur ro // de nas bar snang la rgyu ba rnams rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni /
translated: All the lords of the three worlds and so forth are empowered as great ministers of knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ni /🔽rdo rje 'khyil pa'o //🔽zla ba ni rdo rje 'od do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ni / rdo rje 'khyil pa'o // zla ba ni rdo rje 'od do //
translated: Then the bestowal of the vajra name empowerment to those moving in space is as follows:🔽Amṛtakuṇḍali is Vajrakuṇḍali.🔽Candra is Vajraprabha.

original: be con rtse mo ni rdo rje be con no //
analyzed: be con rtse mo ni rdo rje be con no //
translated: Daṇḍaśikha is Vajradaṇḍa.

original: skya sleng ni rdo rje skya sleng ste /
analyzed: skya sleng ni rdo rje skya sleng ste /
translated: The white-faced is Vajra-mukha.

original: de rnams ni rdo rje khro bor dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni rdo rje khro bor dbang bskur ro //
translated: They were empowered as vajra wrathful ones.

original: de nas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i lha rnams rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽chang gis myos pa ni rdo rjes zin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i lha rnams rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni 'di lta ste / chang gis myos pa ni rdo rjes zin pa'o //
translated: Then the gods who move in the sky gave empowerments with vajra names, such as:🔽The intoxicated is Vajra-graha.

original: chang byed ni rdo rje phreng ba'o //🔽rgyal ba ni rdo rje @20a *//
analyzed: chang byed ni rdo rje phreng ba'o // rgyal ba ni rdo rje @20a *//
translated: The beer-maker is Vajra-mālā.🔽 The victorious is Vajra-vijaya.

original: dbang ngo // rgyal ba skyes pa ni rdo rje rnam par rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: dbang ngo // rgyal ba skyes pa ni rdo rje rnam par rgyal ba ste /
translated: The born victor is Vajra-vijayin.

original: de dag la sogs pa ni tshogs kyi bdag por dbang bskur ro //🔽de nas sa pa rnams rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa ni tshogs kyi bdag por dbang bskur ro // de nas sa pa rnams rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba byin pa ni /
translated: They were empowered as lords of the gaṇas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: mdzod skyong ni rdo rje gru shing ngo //
analyzed: mdzod skyong ni rdo rje gru shing ngo //
translated: The treasury protector is Vajra-dhenuka.

original: rlung ni rdo rje rlung ngo //
analyzed: rlung ni rdo rje rlung ngo //
translated: The wind is Vajra-vāyu.

original: me ni rdo rje me'o //
analyzed: me ni rdo rje me'o //
translated: The fire is Vajra-tejas.

original: ku be ra ni rdo rje 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: ku be ra ni rdo rje 'jigs pa ste /
translated: The Kubera is Vajra-bhaya.

original: de dag la sogs pa ni rdo rje pho nyar dbang bskur ro //

analyzed: mthong bas // dkyil 'khor du ni grub ma gsungs //

original: yang dag ma mthong grub pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma mthong grub pa ni //
translated: One who is accomplished without seeing the truth

original: the tshom can gyis mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: the tshom can gyis mi 'grub bo //
translated: Will not be accomplished by the doubtful.

original: rab tu 'jigs pa rnyed nas su //
analyzed: rab tu 'jigs pa rnyed nas su //
translated: Having attained great fear,

original: nad kyis kyang ni 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: nad kyis kyang ni 'jigs par byed //
translated: They are also frightened by illness.

original: gdon yang de la brtson par 'gyur //
analyzed: gdon yang de la brtson par 'gyur //
translated: Evil spirits will also strive against them,

original: shi nas ngu 'bod du ltung ngo //
analyzed: shi nas ngu 'bod du ltung ngo //
translated: And after death they will fall into the wailing [hells].

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad du chug la nad dang / gdon la sogs pa ston cig /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad du chug la nad dang / gdon la sogs pa ston cig /
translated: Thus, having caused them to enter all the maṇḍalas, show them the illnesses, evil spirits, and so forth.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog ras la bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog ras la bri bar bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathāgata Suvarṇavarṇa, should be painted on cloth.

original: de'i thad 'khor kun tu byang chub sems dpa' brgyad bri ba ni /
analyzed: de'i thad 'khor kun tu byang chub sems dpa' brgyad bri ba ni /
translated: Around him, all around, eight bodhisattvas should be painted.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: g-yas phyogs su ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po dang / 'jam dpal dang / sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po dang / 'jam dpal dang / sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: To the right, noble Avalokiteśvara, Mañjuśrī, and the one who turned the wheel of Dharma as soon as he generated the mind of awakening;

original: g-yon phyogs su ni rdo rje khu tshur dang / byams pa dang / nam mkha'i mdzod do //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su ni rdo rje khu tshur dang / byams pa dang / nam mkha'i mdzod do //
translated: to the left, Vajramuṣṭi, Maitreya, and Ākāśagarbha;

original: steng du nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: steng du nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: above, Ākāśagarbha;

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'og tu ni phyag na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'og tu ni phyag na rdo rje ste /
translated: below the Blessed One, Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag na rdo rje dang bcas pa lag pa gnyis kyis bcing ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag na rdo rje dang bcas pa lag pa gnyis kyis bcing ngo //
translated: He should be painted with Vajrahuṃkāra Vajrapāṇi, holding a vajra in both hands.

original: lag pa gnyis po gzhan la g-yas pa ni rdo rje gsor /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis po gzhan la g-yas pa ni rdo rje gsor /
translated: In the other two hands, the right one should hold a vajra,

original: g-yon pas ni me tog gi gzhu dang / mda' lnga bsnams pa //
analyzed: g-yon pas ni me tog gi gzhu dang / mda' lnga bsnams pa //
translated: and the left one should hold a flower bow and five arrows.

original: sku mdog ni autpal sngon po lta bu /
analyzed: sku mdog ni autpal sngon po lta bu /
translated: His body color is like that of the blue lotus.

original: yid tsam 'dzum la mche ba cung zad gtsigs la /
analyzed: yid tsam 'dzum la mche ba cung zad gtsigs la /
translated: With a slight smile, slightly baring his fangs,

original: khro ba dang bcas pas bzhad pa'i zhal /
analyzed: khro ba dang bcas pas bzhad pa'i zhal /
translated: his face is laughing with wrath.

original: phyir brkyang bsku ma du gnas pa /
analyzed: phyir brkyang bsku ma du gnas pa /
translated: His right leg is extended, and his left leg is bent.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: zhabs g-yon @25b bas lha chen po'i 'dan pa g-yon par mnan /
analyzed: zhabs g-yon @25b bas lha chen po'i 'dan pa g-yon par mnan /
translated: His left foot presses down on the left foot of the great god.

original: zhabs g-yas pa bskum pas au ma'i nu mar btsir te /🔽stod g-yog khra bos yan lag g-yogs pa /
analyzed: zhabs g-yas pa bskum pas au ma'i nu mar btsir te / stod g-yog khra bos yan lag g-yogs pa /
translated: His right foot is bent, pressing on the breast of Umā.🔽He is covered with a variegated upper garment.

original: ko rlon gyi smad g-yogs can /
analyzed: ko rlon gyi smad g-yogs can /
translated: He wears a lower garment of elephant hide.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dbu rgyan du thogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dbu rgyan du thogs pa'o //
translated: He wears a crown of all the tathāgatas.

original: de nas tshes zhag gcig nas mgo brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas tshes zhag gcig nas mgo brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning on the first day of the lunar month,

original: tshes bco lnga'am /
analyzed: tshes bco lnga'am /
translated: for fifteen days,

original: zla ba'am / lo'i par du nyin re zhing brgya stong bzlas te gos dkar po gtsang ma bgos te bdag gi khyim du gnas shing zas gtsang ma yid bzhin du zos te bzlas na de nas zla ba gcig lon pa dang / zla ba dang pos ni h'um zhes bya bas phyi rol gyi las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba'am / lo'i par du nyin re zhing brgya stong bzlas te gos dkar po gtsang ma bgos te bdag gi khyim du gnas shing zas gtsang ma yid bzhin du zos te bzlas na de nas zla ba gcig lon pa dang / zla ba dang pos ni h'um zhes bya bas phyi rol gyi las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: by the first month, external activities will be accomplished with the syllable hūṃ.

original: gnyis kyis ni las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the second, all activities will be accomplished.

original: gsum gyis ni bcom ldan 'das rmi lam du ston cing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa thams cad ston to //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni bcom ldan 'das rmi lam du ston cing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa thams cad ston to //
translated: By the third, the Blessed One will appear in one's dreams and reveal all past and future events.

original: bzhis ni sems can thams cad dgug pa dang / dbang du bya par nus so //
analyzed: bzhis ni sems can thams cad dgug pa dang / dbang du bya par nus so //
translated: By the fourth, one will be able to summon and enthrall all beings.

original: zla ba lngas ni yid bzhin snang ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba lngas ni yid bzhin snang ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the fifth month, one will become invisible at will.

original: zla ba drug gis ni ci 'dod pa thams cad kyi gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba drug gis ni ci 'dod pa thams cad kyi gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the sixth month, one will assume any form one desires.

original: zla ba bdun gyis ni bdag gi lus sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / phyag na rdo rjer ston cing cho 'phrul thams cad kyang ston to //
analyzed: zla ba bdun gyis ni bdag gi lus sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / phyag na rdo rjer ston cing cho 'phrul thams cad kyang ston to //
translated: In seven months, my body will display the form of the Buddha, the bodhisattvas, and Vajrapāṇi, and will display all miracles.

original: zla ba brgyad kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha la sogs pa dgug pa dang / dgug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du @26a *//🔽byed cing las su bsgo'o //
analyzed: zla ba brgyad kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha la sogs pa dgug pa dang / dgug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du @26a *// byed cing las su bsgo'o //
translated: In eight months, I will summon the gods and so forth of the trichiliocosm, and I will summon, bind, and employ them as servants.

original: zla ba dgus ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byed do //
analyzed: zla ba dgus ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byed do //
translated: In nine months, I will summon, enter, bind, and control all bodhisattvas.

original: zla ba bcus ni sa bcu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba bcus ni sa bcu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In ten months, I will attain the tenth stage.

original: zla ba bcu gcig gis ni bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa thob bo //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gcig gis ni bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa thob bo //
translated: In eleven months, I will attain the eleventh stage, the stage of the Buddha.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis pas ni rdo rje 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis pas ni rdo rje 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In twelve months, I will become Vajradhara.

original: de nas sgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa bstan te /
translated: Then, the accomplishment is taught:🔽“One should draw a vajra with the syllable hūṃ on cloth,

original: ras la rdo rje h'um zhes pa de bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: ras la rdo rje h'um zhes pa de bzhin du bris la /
translated: and

original: de'i thad 'khor thams cad du mthu chen po la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de'i thad 'khor thams cad du mthu chen po la sogs pa nas /
translated: In this regard, all the retinue, beginning with Mahābala,

original: klu b'a ru na'i mtha'i bar du bcom ldan 'das la sgong zhing pus mo gtsugs pa bris la /
analyzed: klu b'a ru na'i mtha'i bar du bcom ldan 'das la sgong zhing pus mo gtsugs pa bris la /
translated: up to the nāga Vāruna, should be drawn bowing to the Blessed One with their knees on the ground.

original: de nas de bzhin du bzlas pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya grangs med par bzlas te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du bzlas pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya grangs med par bzlas te /
translated: Then, reciting in the same way, one should recite the mantra of the Vajra Hūṃkāra countless times,

original: zla ba'i mtha'i bar du //
analyzed: zla ba'i mtha'i bar du //
translated: up to the end of the month.

original: tshes nyi shu dgu'i mtshan thal byung bzlas na /
analyzed: tshes nyi shu dgu'i mtshan thal byung bzlas na /
translated: If one recites throughout the night of the twenty-ninth day,

original: nang par thams cad 'ong ngo //
analyzed: nang par thams cad 'ong ngo //
translated: all will come in the morning.

original: 'ongs nas kyang dbang du 'gyur te thams cad bsgo ba bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: 'ongs nas kyang dbang du 'gyur te thams cad bsgo ba bzhin du byed do //
translated: And having come, they will be under one's control, and will do everything as commanded.

original: de nas sgrub pa gzhan 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa gzhan 'byung ste /
translated: Then, another accomplishment will arise.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bris nas gser gyi mdangs kyi lha mo la sogs pa thams cad rang rang gi phyag rgya bsgreng nas gar byed cing mi sdug pa 'jigs pa'i gzugs su bri'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bris nas gser gyi mdangs kyi lha mo la sogs pa thams cad rang rang gi phyag rgya bsgreng nas gar byed cing mi sdug pa 'jigs pa'i gzugs su bri'o //
translated: Having drawn the Blessed One in the same way, all the goddesses beginning with Suvarṇaprabhā should be drawn dancing with their individual mudrās raised, with terrifying and frightening forms.

original: de nas de bzhin du zla ba gcig gi mtha'i mtshan thal byung du zlos shig /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du zla ba gcig gi mtha'i mtshan thal byung du zlos shig /
translated: Then, reciting in the same way throughout the night up to the end of the month,

original: de nas nang par kun lhags te /
analyzed: de nas nang par kun lhags te /
translated: Then, in the morning, they all come and

original: de bzhin du gar dag gis sgrub pa po la mchod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gar dag gis sgrub pa po la mchod do //
translated: worship the practitioner with dance.

original: @26b 'di la rtog pa 'dir bris pa de bzhin no snyam du bsams nas des mi 'jigs par bya'o //
analyzed: @26b 'di la rtog pa 'dir bris pa de bzhin no snyam du bsams nas des mi 'jigs par bya'o //
translated: One should think, “This is just as it is written in the tantra,” and not be afraid.

original: de nas dbang du 'gyur ste /
analyzed: de nas dbang du 'gyur ste /
translated: Then, they become subject to one’s will.

original: rtag tu las thams cad byed pa'i g-yog mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu las thams cad byed pa'i g-yog mor 'gyur ro //
translated: They become servants who always do all one’s bidding.

original: de nas cho ga gzhan te ras la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: de nas cho ga gzhan te ras la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bris la /
translated: Next, the other rite: Having drawn the Blessed One in the same way on cloth,

original: de nas de bzhin du brgyad stong du bzlas na nub tha ma la rdo rje 'dzin pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du brgyad stong du bzlas na nub tha ma la rdo rje 'dzin pa 'thob ste /
translated: then, if one repeats [the mantra] eight thousand times, at the end of the last watch one attains Vajradhara,

original: ci 'dod pa grub pa'i mchog kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa grub pa'i mchog kyang 'thob bo //
translated: and also the supreme accomplishment of whatever one desires.

original: gzhan yang sgrub pa phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar 'bum zlos shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrub pa phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar 'bum zlos shig /
translated: Moreover, one should repeat the mantra one hundred thousand times in front of the accomplishment of Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas dgos pa kun bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas dgos pa kun bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //
translated: Then, the Blessed One will accomplish all one’s needs.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar ci 'dod par yam shing thams cad kyis sbyin sreg gis lo gcig gi bar du bsregs na thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar ci 'dod par yam shing thams cad kyis sbyin sreg gis lo gcig gi bar du bsregs na thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of Vajrapāṇi, one should perform a homa with all the firewood as desired for one year.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um zhes pa bris pa de'i spyan sngar lo gcig gi mtha'i bar du grangs med par zlos shig /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um zhes pa bris pa de'i spyan sngar lo gcig gi mtha'i bar du grangs med par zlos shig /
translated: Then, in front of the written Vajra Hūṃkāra, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times for one year.

original: de nas tha mar bcom ldan 'das rang gi ci 'dod pa'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: de nas tha mar bcom ldan 'das rang gi ci 'dod pa'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro // bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Then, in the end, the Blessed One will grant whatever supreme boon one desires.🔽In front of the Blessed One, one should form the mudrā of Vajra Hūṃkāra

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gul gyi bar du zlos shig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gul gyi bar du zlos shig /
translated: and recite the mantra until the Blessed One shakes.

original: de nas phyag rgya 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the mudrā will be accomplished.

original: grub pa des na dgug pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / gzhug pa dang / drang pa dang / ltung ba dang / dbab pa dang / stan 'pho ba la sogs pa las phran tshegs kyi bcings pas h'um zhes pas mdzad do //
analyzed: grub pa des na dgug pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / gzhug pa dang / drang pa dang / ltung ba dang / dbab pa dang / stan 'pho ba la sogs pa las phran tshegs kyi bcings pas h'um zhes pas mdzad do //
translated: Having accomplished that, he binds with the minor rites of summoning, enthralling, entering, attracting, casting down, bringing under one's power, and so forth, with hum!

original: de nas cho ga @27a *//
analyzed: de nas cho ga @27a *//
translated: Then, the other rite:

original: gzhan te rig pas dbang bskur bar bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan te rig pas dbang bskur bar bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to confer initiation with the knowledge [mantra],

original: bri'am / 'jim pa las phyag na rdo rje'i cha lugs byas la phyag gnyis brkyang ste rdo rje 'dzin to /
analyzed: bri'am / 'jim pa las phyag na rdo rje'i cha lugs byas la phyag gnyis brkyang ste rdo rje 'dzin to /
translated: one should make Vajrapāṇi's form either drawn or made of clay, with two outstretched hands holding a vajra.

original: de zla ba yar gyi tshes gcig nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de zla ba yar gyi tshes gcig nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning on the first day of the waxing moon,

original: tshes bco lnga'i bar du mar bzhi bre brgyad kyis khrus shig /
analyzed: tshes bco lnga'i bar du mar bzhi bre brgyad kyis khrus shig /
translated: one should bathe [the image] with four measures of clarified butter and eight measures of milk.

original: de nas tha mar mtshan thal byung bzlas so //
analyzed: de nas tha mar mtshan thal byung bzlas so //
translated: Then, at the end, one should recite [the knowledge mantra] throughout the night.

original: de nas nad par gzugs de bzhad de /
analyzed: de nas nad par gzugs de bzhad de /
translated: Then, one should place the image in front of the patient.

original: de nas rig pa thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one will become the lord of all knowledge mantras.

original: de nas sgrub pa gzhan 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa gzhan 'byung ste /
translated: Then, another rite arises:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi cha lugs bri'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi cha lugs bri'am /
translated: One should draw the form of the Blessed Buddha, Śākyamuni, with a peaceful expression, seated on a lion throne, with a canopy above, and surrounded by bodhisattvas.

original: 'jig pa la de bzhin du phyag brkyang ba rdo rje 'dzin par byas la de'i zhabs kyi bar du spos chus bkrus na de phyin chad yid bzhin du mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa la de bzhin du phyag brkyang ba rdo rje 'dzin par byas la de'i zhabs kyi bar du spos chus bkrus na de phyin chad yid bzhin du mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, extend the hand to the one who is to be destroyed, making him into a vajra holder, and wash his feet with perfumed water. From then on, he will not appear as he was before.

original: de nas sgrub pa gzhan 'byung ste ras la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje phyag bzhi par byas la /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa gzhan 'byung ste ras la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje phyag bzhi par byas la /
translated: Next, the other accomplishment arises. On cloth, make the Blessed Vajrapāṇi with four hands.

original: de'i phyag g-yas par padmo /🔽g-yon par rdo rje /
analyzed: de'i phyag g-yas par padmo / g-yon par rdo rje /
translated: In his right hand he holds a lotus,🔽in his left a vajra,

original: g-yas par rdo rje h'um zhes pa /
analyzed: g-yas par rdo rje h'um zhes pa /
translated: in the right a vajra hūṃ,

original: g-yon par mda' dang / gzhu'o /
analyzed: g-yon par mda' dang / gzhu'o /
translated: and in the left a bow and arrow.

original: de nas de'i spyan sngar stong phrag brgya bzlas pa'i mjug tu zhag gsum smyung ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas de'i spyan sngar stong phrag brgya bzlas pa'i mjug tu zhag gsum smyung ba byas te /
translated: Then, in front of him, having recited one hundred thousand times, at the end, fasting for three days,

original: mtshan thal byung bzlas na /
analyzed: mtshan thal byung bzlas na /
translated: recite at night.

original: de'i nang bar de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i nang bar de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs su 'gyur te /
translated: In the middle of that, he will become a form like him.

original: bskal par gnas shing mi dga' ba dang / sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba dang / thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal par gnas shing mi dga' ba dang / sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba dang / thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for an eon, and will be able to enthrall all sentient beings and go everywhere.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor sgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor sgrub pa 'byung ste /
translated: Next, the accomplishment of the maṇḍala arises.

original: dkyil 'khor @27b mthong bas lci ba gsum gyis khrus byas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor @27b mthong bas lci ba gsum gyis khrus byas /
translated: Having seen the maṇḍala, one should bathe with the three heavy [fragrances].

original: dus gsum du gos brjes la /
analyzed: dus gsum du gos brjes la /
translated: One should change one's clothes three times.

original: rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas brgyad stong dus gsum du nyin bdun bzlas na /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas brgyad stong dus gsum du nyin bdun bzlas na /
translated: Having formed the mudrā of Vajradhṛk, one should recite [the mantra] eight thousand times in the three times for seven days.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes slob dpon gyi gzugs su byas nas rmi lam du thams cad smra'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes slob dpon gyi gzugs su byas nas rmi lam du thams cad smra'o //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, having assumed the form of the master, will speak everything in a dream.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i cho ga gzhan 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i cho ga gzhan 'byung ste /
translated: Then the rite of accomplishing the maṇḍala arises.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po mthong bas zla ba gcig gi bar du de bzhin du dus gsum du khrus byas nas dus gsum du gos brjes /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po mthong bas zla ba gcig gi bar du de bzhin du dus gsum du khrus byas nas dus gsum du gos brjes /
translated: Having seen the great maṇḍala, one should bathe in the same way three times a day for one month, changing one's clothes three times.

original: dus gsum du ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor bas te /🔽rno lcags kyi mtshon chas der rdo rje bris la /
analyzed: dus gsum du ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor bas te / rno lcags kyi mtshon chas der rdo rje bris la /
translated: Three times one should anoint the maṇḍala with cow dung.🔽One should draw a vajra there with a sharp iron weapon.

original: de la lta zhing rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: de la lta zhing rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Gazing at that, one should form the mudrā of Vajradhṛk.

original: brgyad brgya bzlas na zla ba gcig gi mthar bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: brgyad brgya bzlas na zla ba gcig gi mthar bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: If one recites [the mantra] eight hundred times, at the end of one month one will see the Blessed One.

original: de nas rdo rje sgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sgrub pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then the accomplishment of the vajra arises.

original: rdo rje ras sam /
analyzed: rdo rje ras sam /
translated: Having written it on a vajra, cloth,

original: rtsig pa'am / shing leb la bris nas de la mchod pa byas te rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la /
analyzed: rtsig pa'am / shing leb la bris nas de la mchod pa byas te rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la /
translated: wall, or wooden board, worship it, and holding it with a vajra fist,

original: lo gcig tshun chad rdo rje nam 'bar gyi bar du zlos shig /
analyzed: lo gcig tshun chad rdo rje nam 'bar gyi bar du zlos shig /
translated: recite it for a year, until the vajra blazes.

original: 'bar ba des na nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / lo bcu drug lon pa'i lus phyag na rdo rje dang mtshungs pa'i gzugs dang / stobs dang / mdog tu gyur te /
analyzed: 'bar ba des na nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / lo bcu drug lon pa'i lus phyag na rdo rje dang mtshungs pa'i gzugs dang / stobs dang / mdog tu gyur te /
translated: By that blazing, one will fly through space, and one’s body will become like that of Vajrapāṇi, with the form of a sixteen-year-old, with strength and complexion.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: One will have all the enjoyments of desire.

original: bde ba dang / yid ba de ba thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid ba de ba thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain all happiness and joy.

original: tshe yang lo stong phrag brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe yang lo stong phrag brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s life will be a hundred thousand years.

original: de nas ral gri sgrub pa 'phyung ste /🔽rdo rje khu tshur gyis ral gri bzung la lo gcig gi bar du bzlas na rig @28a *//
analyzed: de nas ral gri sgrub pa 'phyung ste / rdo rje khu tshur gyis ral gri bzung la lo gcig gi bar du bzlas na rig @28a *//
translated: Next, the sword practice is taught.

original: 'dzin thams cad kyi bdag po rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin thams cad kyi bdag po rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds a sword with a vajra fist and recites it for a year, one will become a master of all awareness holders.

original: de nas 'khor lo sgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo sgrub pa 'byung ste /
translated: Next, the practice of the discus is taught.

original: 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor bris la lcags kyi 'khor lo thogs nas /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor bris la lcags kyi 'khor lo thogs nas /
translated: Having drawn a wheel maṇḍala, one should take up an iron wheel.

original: nam rdo rjer gyur cing slar yang 'khor lor gyur gyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: nam rdo rjer gyur cing slar yang 'khor lor gyur gyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: Recite until it becomes a vajra and again becomes a wheel.

original: de nas de thogs pas na rig 'dzin thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de thogs pas na rig 'dzin thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having taken it up, one will turn the wheel of all vidyādharas.

original: de nas kyo ba tang bsgrub par 'dod pas phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar gser gyi kyo ba tang bya ste /
analyzed: de nas kyo ba tang bsgrub par 'dod pas phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar gser gyi kyo ba tang bya ste /
translated: Next, one who wishes to accomplish the hook should make a golden hook in front of Vajrapāṇi.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la /
translated: Holding it with the left vajra fist,

original: grub pa rnam gsum du gyur gyi bar du bzlas la dros pa tsam gyis thams cad kun dgug nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa rnam gsum du gyur gyi bar du bzlas la dros pa tsam gyis thams cad kun dgug nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: recite until the three accomplishments occur. By merely brandishing it, one will be able to summon all.

original: dud pa byung ba tsam gyis thams cad dbang du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud pa byung ba tsam gyis thams cad dbang du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the mere appearance of smoke, one will be able to enthrall all.

original: 'bar bas ni thams cad dgug nus pa dang / dbang du bya nus shing rig 'dzin gyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bar bas ni thams cad dgug nus pa dang / dbang du bya nus shing rig 'dzin gyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: By the blazing, one will be able to summon and enthrall all, and become a king of vidyādharas.

original: de nas lha la sogs pa thams cad dgu pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas lha la sogs pa thams cad dgu pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then, all gods and so forth will be summoned.

original: lha chen po la sogs pa lha rnams gang yang rung ba'i cha lugs rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la /
analyzed: lha chen po la sogs pa lha rnams gang yang rung ba'i cha lugs rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la /
translated: Having placed one's left foot on the head of any god, such as Maheśvara,

original: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: one should bind the vajra hūṃkāra mudra.

original: bsdigs shing zla ba gcig gi mtha'i bar du bzlas na lha thams cad lhags te /
analyzed: bsdigs shing zla ba gcig gi mtha'i bar du bzlas na lha thams cad lhags te /
translated: Threatening them, if one repeats [the mantra] until the end of the month, all the gods will arrive.

original: las thams cad byed pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las thams cad byed pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become servants who do all one's bidding.

original: klu dbang du bya bar 'dod na klu'i mtshor lte ba man chad chu'i nang du bcug la lo gcig tshun chad klu thams cad rang gi gzugs su ston @28b cing las thams cad byed pa'i g-yog tu gyur gyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: klu dbang du bya bar 'dod na klu'i mtshor lte ba man chad chu'i nang du bcug la lo gcig tshun chad klu thams cad rang gi gzugs su ston @28b cing las thams cad byed pa'i g-yog tu gyur gyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: If one wishes to subjugate the nāgas, having submerged one's navel and below into a nāga lake, one should repeat [the mantra] until all the nāgas show themselves in their own forms and become servants who do all one's bidding.

original: gnod sbyin dbang du bya bar 'dod pas gnod sbyin gang la gnas pa'i gnas der rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings la gnod sbyin de dag lhags te bka' ci stsal zhes smra ba'i bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dbang du bya bar 'dod pas gnod sbyin gang la gnas pa'i gnas der rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings la gnod sbyin de dag lhags te bka' ci stsal zhes smra ba'i bar du bzlas so //
translated: If one wishes to subjugate the yakṣas, having bound the vajra hūṃkāra mudra at the place where the yakṣas reside, one should repeat [the mantra] until the yakṣas arrive and say, What do you command?

original: de phyin cad bka' thams cad byed pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyin cad bka' thams cad byed pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From then on, she will be a servant who does everything that is said.

original: de nas ma rnams thams cad dbang du bya bar 'dod pas ma'i gnas su song nas /
analyzed: de nas ma rnams thams cad dbang du bya bar 'dod pas ma'i gnas su song nas /
translated: Then, if one wishes to enthrall all women, one should go to a mother’s house🔽and, having pressed her foot with one’s foot on the heart of the wrathful one,

original: khro mo'i snying gar rdog pas mnan la zla ba gcig lon gyi bar du bzlas na tshes nyi shu dgu la 'jigs su rung ba'i sgra chen po 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: khro mo'i snying gar rdog pas mnan la zla ba gcig lon gyi bar du bzlas na tshes nyi shu dgu la 'jigs su rung ba'i sgra chen po 'byin par byed de /
translated: one should recite the mantra for one month. On the twenty-ninth day, she will emit a great, terrifying sound.

original: de nas dbang du gyur nas bka' bzhin byed pa'i g-yog mor 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas dbang du gyur nas bka' bzhin byed pa'i g-yog mor 'gyur te /
translated: Then, having become enthralled, she will be a servant who does everything that is said.🔽Carrying her on one’s shoulder, one should lead her to heaven.

original: phrag pa la khyer nas mtho ris su khrid de slar yang khrid cing 'ongs nas tshogs kyi bdag por bcu gcing de dag gis mchod de /
analyzed: phrag pa la khyer nas mtho ris su khrid de slar yang khrid cing 'ongs nas tshogs kyi bdag por bcu gcing de dag gis mchod de /
translated: Having brought her back again, she will be worshipped by the lords of the gaṇas.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i don thams cad dang / 'dod pa thams cad dang / na chung thams cad 'gug go /
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i don thams cad dang / 'dod pa thams cad dang / na chung thams cad 'gug go /
translated: She will bring all the wealth that has not been obtained before, all that is desired, and all the young women.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnal 'byor yang ster te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnal 'byor yang ster te /
translated: She will also grant such yoga,

original: rnal 'byor gang gi khro bo'i 'jig rten du yang 'gro zhing phyir yang 'ong ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gang gi khro bo'i 'jig rten du yang 'gro zhing phyir yang 'ong ngo //
translated: by which one can go to the world of the wrathful ones and return again.

original: de la sus kyang cung zad kyang byed mi nus so //
analyzed: de la sus kyang cung zad kyang byed mi nus so //
translated: No one can do anything to her at all.

original: de nas dpal chen mo bsgrub par 'dod pa des phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar bzlas pa ni phyag na rdo rje'i sku las lha mo'i lus mthong gi bar du ste /
analyzed: de nas dpal chen mo bsgrub par 'dod pa des phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar bzlas pa ni phyag na rdo rje'i sku las lha mo'i lus mthong gi bar du ste /
translated: Then, the one who desires to accomplish the great glory, in front of Vajrapāṇi, should recite [the mantra] until the form of the goddess is seen in the body of Vajrapāṇi.

original: de las ma 'gul cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: de las ma 'gul cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: [The goddess] says, “Do not move from that!”

original: de phyin cad don thams cad ster bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyin cad don thams cad ster bar 'gyur te /
translated: From then on, she will grant all aims,

original: sangs rgyas pa yang ster ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa yang ster ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to granting buddhahood.

original: de nas @29a *//
analyzed: de nas @29a *//
translated: Then,

original: mtsho dbyangs ma dbang du bya bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: mtsho dbyangs ma dbang du bya bar 'dod pa /
translated: the one who desires to bring Sarasvatī under one’s power

original: des phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar yi ge'i phreng bar byas la phreng ba'i yi ge bkod cing mthar phyin pa'i bar du bklags te /
analyzed: des phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar yi ge'i phreng bar byas la phreng ba'i yi ge bkod cing mthar phyin pa'i bar du bklags te /
translated: should make a rosary of her syllables in front of Vajrapāṇi, arrange the syllables of the rosary, and recite [the mantra] until [the goddess] arrives.

original: nyin re zhing dus gsum du las de byas la /
analyzed: nyin re zhing dus gsum du las de byas la /
translated: One should perform that rite three times a day.

original: de nas brgyad stong bzlas na zla ba gcig lon pa dang mtsho dbyangs ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas brgyad stong bzlas na zla ba gcig lon pa dang mtsho dbyangs ma mthong ngo //
translated: Then, when one has recited [the mantra] eight thousand times, after one month one will see Sarasvatī.

original: de phyin chad thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyin chad thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: From then on one will have unimpeded eloquence.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtsug lag thams cad dang / shes nyen can du bya ba thams cad dang / bzo thams cad kyang ma bslabs par des rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtsug lag thams cad dang / shes nyen can du bya ba thams cad dang / bzo thams cad kyang ma bslabs par des rab tu shes so //
translated: He will know all the worldly and transcendent arts, all the skills, and all the crafts without having been taught.

original: de nas lig bu mig dang / gur gum dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla rnams la bsgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas lig bu mig dang / gur gum dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla rnams la bsgrub pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then, the accomplishment of collyrium, saffron, realgar, and mica will occur.

original: lig bu mig blangs la /
analyzed: lig bu mig blangs la /
translated: Take the collyrium.

original: 'jom pa'i steng du bzhag nas lag pas mnan ste grub pa rnam gsum byung gi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: 'jom pa'i steng du bzhag nas lag pas mnan ste grub pa rnam gsum byung gi bar du bzlas so //
translated: Place it on the top of an iron pan, press it down with the hand, and recite until the three signs of accomplishment occur.

original: gcig gis ni mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gis ni mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By one, one will become invisible.

original: gnyis pas ni gzugs mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni gzugs mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: By the second, one will have many forms.

original: gsum pas ni nam gnas gong mar 'dzeg pa na nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pas ni nam gnas gong mar 'dzeg pa na nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the third, one will fly through space when climbing to the upper regions.

original: gur gum la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: gur gum la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: Take the saffron, and so on,

original: 'jom pa'i bu gar bcug la rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas mnan nas nam 'bar gyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: 'jom pa'i bu gar bcug la rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas mnan nas nam 'bar gyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: and place it in the hole of an iron pan. Press it down with the mudra of Vajradhara and recite until it blazes.

original: de nas thig le byas nas 'dod pa thams cad kyi bdag po dang / rig 'dzin dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang / tshe lo stong du thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas thig le byas nas 'dod pa thams cad kyi bdag po dang / rig 'dzin dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang / tshe lo stong du thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having made the bindu, one will become the lord of all desires, a knowledge-holder, able to go everywhere, and able to live for a thousand years.

original: de nas @29b s'a la bhanytsi ka sgrub pa 'byung ste /🔽gnas gang na s'a la bhanytse ka ri mo bris pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas @29b s'a la bhanytsi ka sgrub pa 'byung ste / gnas gang na s'a la bhanytse ka ri mo bris pa 'am /
translated: Then, the accomplishment of sālabhañjikā will occur.🔽In whatever place there is a drawing or image of sālabhañjikā,

original: gzugs su byas pa de'i 'jom pa la sor mo bzhag ste /
analyzed: gzugs su byas pa de'i 'jom pa la sor mo bzhag ste /
translated: place one's finger on her navel,

original: zla ba gcig gi bar du zlos shig /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi bar du zlos shig /
translated: and recite for one month.

original: de nas zla ba gcig gi mthar mtshan thog thag zlos shig /
analyzed: de nas zla ba gcig gi mthar mtshan thog thag zlos shig /
translated: Then, at the end of one month, recite throughout the night.

original: de nas nang bar rang gi gzugs su bstan nas 'dod pa thams cad sbyin pa'i chung mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nang bar rang gi gzugs su bstan nas 'dod pa thams cad sbyin pa'i chung mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in the morning, she will appear in her own form and become one's wife, granting all desires.

original: gnod sbyin mo bsgrub par 'dod pas gnod sbyin mo gang na 'dug pa'i gnas der 'dug la rang gi gzugs su 'ongs kyi bar du bzlas na de la 'dod pa thams cad ster ba'i bran mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo bsgrub par 'dod pas gnod sbyin mo gang na 'dug pa'i gnas der 'dug la rang gi gzugs su 'ongs kyi bar du bzlas na de la 'dod pa thams cad ster ba'i bran mor 'gyur ro //
translated: One who wishes to accomplish a yakṣiṇī should go to the place where the yakṣiṇī resides and recite until she comes in her own form. She will become one's servant, granting all desires.

original: de nas sha za mo bsgrub par 'dod pas phyag dar phung po mes btang ste /
analyzed: de nas sha za mo bsgrub par 'dod pas phyag dar phung po mes btang ste /
translated: Then, one who desires to accomplish a flesh-eating ghost should burn a heap of rubbish with fire.

original: lag pa g-yon pas rang gi mtshan ma de bzung la g-yas pas zegs ma bsregs pa ni phyag dar gyi phung po de las ci tsam du sha za mo gdong mdangs gzugs mi sdug pa 'ongs te rang gi gzugs su gnas so //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas rang gi mtshan ma de bzung la g-yas pas zegs ma bsregs pa ni phyag dar gyi phung po de las ci tsam du sha za mo gdong mdangs gzugs mi sdug pa 'ongs te rang gi gzugs su gnas so //
translated: Holding that sign with the left hand, and burning a wick with the right, from that heap of rubbish a flesh-eating ghost with a pale face and an ugly form comes as much as one desires and remains in one’s form.

original: de yang de bzhin du bran mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du bran mor 'gyur ro //
translated: She also becomes a servant in that way.

original: de nas ci bgyi bsgrub par 'dod pas nyin zhag gcig smyung ba byas la /
analyzed: de nas ci bgyi bsgrub par 'dod pas nyin zhag gcig smyung ba byas la /
translated: Then, one who desires to accomplish whatever one wishes should fast for one day and night.

original: tshes nyi shu dgu la brgyad stong bzlas te /
analyzed: tshes nyi shu dgu la brgyad stong bzlas te /
translated: Recite [the mantra] eight thousand times on the twenty-ninth day.

original: de nas zla ba gcig slong mo la za zhing grangs med par bzlas te /
analyzed: de nas zla ba gcig slong mo la za zhing grangs med par bzlas te /
translated: Then, eating alms for one month, recite [the mantra] without counting.

original: zla ba gcig lon pa dang nub gsum smyung ba byas nas mtshan thog thag zlas so //
analyzed: zla ba gcig lon pa dang nub gsum smyung ba byas nas mtshan thog thag zlas so //
translated: When one month has passed, fast for three nights and recite [the mantra] all night.

original: de nas nang par ci bgyi 'ongs na des mi 'jigs par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas nang par ci bgyi 'ongs na des mi 'jigs par bya ste /
translated: Then, when she comes in the morning, one should not be afraid of her.

original: de nas de rang nas 'grub bo //
analyzed: de nas de rang nas 'grub bo //
translated: Then, she is accomplished right there.

original: de phyin cad 'dod pa thams cad 'bul ba'i g-yog tu 'gyur te /🔽mtho ris kyi lha mo'ang 'gugs shing 'bul lo //
analyzed: de phyin cad 'dod pa thams cad 'bul ba'i g-yog tu 'gyur te / mtho ris kyi lha mo'ang 'gugs shing 'bul lo //
translated: From then on, he will be a servant who offers all that is desired.

original: de yang @30a *//
analyzed: de yang @30a *//
translated: He will summon and offer even the celestial maidens of the higher celestial realms.🔽And he will summon them

original: skyel cing slar yang 'gugs so //
analyzed: skyel cing slar yang 'gugs so //
translated: and send them back.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi thams cad kyang smra'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi thams cad kyang smra'o //
translated: He will speak of all things past, future, and present.

original: gzhan gyi nor thams cad kyang phrog nas 'bul lo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor thams cad kyang phrog nas 'bul lo //
translated: He will steal all the wealth of others and offer it.

original: de nas rig pa'i brtul zhugs bya bar 'dod pa dngos grub med pa gang yin pa des zla ba drug gi bar du nyin zhag bcu bcu zhing spyad pa snga ma brjes la slong mo'i kha zas la sogs pa nas rlung bza' ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa'i brtul zhugs bya bar 'dod pa dngos grub med pa gang yin pa des zla ba drug gi bar du nyin zhag bcu bcu zhing spyad pa snga ma brjes la slong mo'i kha zas la sogs pa nas rlung bza' ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, one who desires to practice the conduct of knowledge but does not have spiritual powers should practice for six months, changing the previous practice every ten days, from eating alms-food and so forth up to eating wind.

original: de nas mjug tu mtshan thal byung bzlas na nang par sangs rgyas pa yang sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mjug tu mtshan thal byung bzlas na nang par sangs rgyas pa yang sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, at the end, if he recites at midnight, he will obtain the ability to give even the enlightenment of the morning.

original: de nas nyin re zhing bco brgyad kyi bar du sngon gyi spyad pa rnams byas la de'i mjug tu mtshan thal byung bzlas na nang par las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba ni h'um zhes thang cig brjod pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nas nyin re zhing bco brgyad kyi bar du sngon gyi spyad pa rnams byas la de'i mjug tu mtshan thal byung bzlas na nang par las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba ni h'um zhes thang cig brjod pas kyang ngo //
translated: Then, every day for eighteen days, one should perform the previous conduct, and at the end of that, if one recites at night until dawn, all activities will be accomplished by morning.

original: de nas rol langs bsgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas rol langs bsgrub pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then, the sādhana of the risen corpse will occur.

original: ma smras ma nyams pa'i mi ro blangs la legs par bkrus nas byug pas legs par byugs te /
analyzed: ma smras ma nyams pa'i mi ro blangs la legs par bkrus nas byug pas legs par byugs te /
translated: Take an undamaged corpse that has not been cremated, wash it well, anoint it well,

original: me tog gi phreng ba btags nas rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la dbugs byung gi bar du bzlas na de ldang ste langs pa dang / de zhon na thams cad du 'gro zhing tshe yang lo stong phrag brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba btags nas rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la dbugs byung gi bar du bzlas na de ldang ste langs pa dang / de zhon na thams cad du 'gro zhing tshe yang lo stong phrag brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: tie a garland of flowers around its neck, and press down on it with one’s left foot. If one recites until it breathes, it will rise. If one mounts it, one will go everywhere, and one’s lifespan will be one hundred thousand years.

original: de nas ro langs kyi grub pa mchog sgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas ro langs kyi grub pa mchog sgrub pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then, the sādhana of the supreme accomplishment of the risen corpse will occur.

original: ma smas ma nyams pa'i mi ro blangs nas de bzhin du rab tu brgyan la zhon te langs shing yang 'gyel ba'i bar du bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma smas ma nyams pa'i mi ro blangs nas de bzhin du rab tu brgyan la zhon te langs shing yang 'gyel ba'i bar du bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes an undamaged human corpse, adorns it in the same way, mounts it, and recites the mantra until one stands up and falls down again, it will become the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de phrag pa la khyer na de bzhin gshegs @30b pa thams cad srel ba'i rig 'dzin 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyi 'gro ba dang / tshe yang bskal bar 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsungs so //🔽de nas ma bsgrubs kyang dkyil 'khor mthong ba nyid kyis las su 'gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de phrag pa la khyer na de bzhin gshegs @30b pa thams cad srel ba'i rig 'dzin 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyi 'gro ba dang / tshe yang bskal bar 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsungs so // de nas ma bsgrubs kyang dkyil 'khor mthong ba nyid kyis las su 'gyur pa ni /
translated: If one carries it on one’s shoulder, one will become a vidyādhara who travels to all the world systems of the ten directions, and one’s lifespan will be an eon. Thus has declared Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Next, the activity that occurs merely by seeing the maṇḍala, even without accomplishment, is as follows.

original: thang cig brjod pas ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / rgyal po la sogs pa bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thang cig brjod pas ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / rgyal po la sogs pa bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it once, oneself, others, villages, towns, kings, and so on will be protected.

original: mtshams bcad pa la sogs pa ni brtan par lta bas mtshams bcad na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mi 'da' na gzhan lta ci smos /
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa la sogs pa ni brtan par lta bas mtshams bcad na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mi 'da' na gzhan lta ci smos /
translated: As for the boundary-setting and so forth, if one views [the boundary] as firm, then all the Tathagatas do not pass beyond it, let alone others.

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor dang / nam mkha' dang / phyogs bcing ba yang lta ba des so //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor dang / nam mkha' dang / phyogs bcing ba yang lta ba des so //
translated: The binding of the earth-mandala, the sky, and the directions is also by that view.🔽As for the descent, it is by contact or non-contact with the sword, mirror, vessel, thumb, tree, drawing, costume, bow, arrow, vajra, and so forth.

original: dbab pa ni reg pa dang / ma reg pas ral gri dang / me long dang / snod dang / mthe bo dang / shing ljon pa dang / bris pa dang / cha lugs dang / gzhu dang / mda' dang / rdo rje la sogs pa rdo rje dbab pa'i phyag rgya gos kyis g-yogs la bcings te /🔽gu gul gyi bdag pas dbab bo //
analyzed: dbab pa ni reg pa dang / ma reg pas ral gri dang / me long dang / snod dang / mthe bo dang / shing ljon pa dang / bris pa dang / cha lugs dang / gzhu dang / mda' dang / rdo rje la sogs pa rdo rje dbab pa'i phyag rgya gos kyis g-yogs la bcings te / gu gul gyi bdag pas dbab bo //
translated: The descent is by the vajra-descent seal covered with cloth.

original: gdon zhi bar bya ba ni h'um zhes pas so //
analyzed: gdon zhi bar bya ba ni h'um zhes pas so //
translated: The pacification of spirits is by the syllable hūṃ.

original: rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgyas ni sems can thams cad 'phungs par byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgyas ni sems can thams cad 'phungs par byed do //
translated: By the vajra-hūṃ seal, all sentient beings are summoned.

original: rdo rje lcags sgrog gi phyag rgyas ni byad ma'i gdon las thar par byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags sgrog gi phyag rgyas ni byad ma'i gdon las thar par byed do //
translated: By the vajra-chain seal, one is freed from the spirit of a witch.

original: he ru ka rdo rje'i phyag rgya bstan pas ni byad mas bsad pa las slar gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: he ru ka rdo rje'i phyag rgya bstan pas ni byad mas bsad pa las slar gso bar bya'o //
translated: By displaying the Heruka-vajra seal, one should revive someone who has been killed by a spell.

original: rdo rje'i phyag rgya gzung bas skra las bzung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i phyag rgya gzung bas skra las bzung ste /
translated: By holding the vajra seal and pulling out the hair,🔽one should suppress poison,

original: bslang bas ni dug gnon pa dang / dug bslang @31a *//
analyzed: bslang bas ni dug gnon pa dang / dug bslang @31a *//
translated: extract poison,

original: ba dang / dug zhi bar bya ba dang / dug spo ba dang / dug gzhig par bya ba dang / dug gis shi ba las gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: ba dang / dug zhi bar bya ba dang / dug spo ba dang / dug gzhig par bya ba dang / dug gis shi ba las gso bar bya ste /
translated: pacify poison, transfer poison, destroy poison, and revive someone who has died from poison.

original: rdo rje h'um zhes pa gcig gis so //🔽gter dbyung ba ni zangs kyi ril ba chus bkang la /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes pa gcig gis so // gter dbyung ba ni zangs kyi ril ba chus bkang la /
translated: [One should do so] with the single vajra hūṃ.🔽As for bringing forth treasure, one should fill a copper bowl with water,

original: rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i mdzub mo dang / gu gul gyis bdug pa byas te bzlas na gal te gter yod na ni chu de lud do //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i mdzub mo dang / gu gul gyis bdug pa byas te bzlas na gal te gter yod na ni chu de lud do //
translated: and if there is treasure, the water will overflow.

original: de ste med na ni 'khyil lo //
analyzed: de ste med na ni 'khyil lo //
translated: If there is none, it will swirl.

original: de nas 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i h'um zhes pa bzlas te blang ngo //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i h'um zhes pa bzlas te blang ngo //
translated: Then, one should recite the Trailokyavijaya hūṃ and take it.

original: snang ba dgug pa ni dong ka'i ljon pa'i yam shing gis ma bus te /
analyzed: snang ba dgug pa ni dong ka'i ljon pa'i yam shing gis ma bus te /
translated: As for summoning light, one should not fan with kindling wood from a neem tree.

original: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis r'a dza ko sh'a ta ka'i me tog la bskus nas stong phrag brgyad bsregs na snang ba thob bo //
analyzed: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis r'a dza ko sh'a ta ka'i me tog la bskus nas stong phrag brgyad bsregs na snang ba thob bo //
translated: If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight Rājakas flowers smeared with curd, honey, and ghee, one will obtain radiance.

original: 'og gi gnas su ni rdo rje 'og gi phyag rgyas 'khrul 'khor thams cad bcom nas rdo rje h'um zhes pa bzlas te zhugs na de la sus kyang gtse bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og gi gnas su ni rdo rje 'og gi phyag rgyas 'khrul 'khor thams cad bcom nas rdo rje h'um zhes pa bzlas te zhugs na de la sus kyang gtse bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one enters the lower region with the vajra lower mudra, having destroyed all the mechanisms with the mantra of Vajra Hūṃkāra, no one will be able to harm one there.

original: gtogs 'dod kyi 'khor los kyang ci yang byed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rdo rje 'am //🔽nor bu marga ti'am /
analyzed: gtogs 'dod kyi 'khor los kyang ci yang byed par mi 'gyur ro // phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rdo rje 'am // nor bu marga ti'am /
translated: One will not be affected by any weapon.

original: padma r'a ga 'am /🔽mu tig gam /
analyzed: padma r'a ga 'am / mu tig gam /
translated: In front of Vajrapāṇi, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of vajra,🔽cat’s eye gem,🔽ruby,🔽pearl,

original: gser ram / dbyig gam /
analyzed: gser ram / dbyig gam /
translated: gold,

original: gzhan ci yang rung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan ci yang rung ba'am /
translated: or whatever else one can afford,

original: skyes pa'am / bud med dam /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med dam /
translated: male or female,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la lo gcig gi bar du dus gsum du brgya brgyar bzlas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la lo gcig gi bar du dus gsum du brgya brgyar bzlas nas /
translated: for one year, reciting the mantra three times a day.

original: de nas lo gcig lon na brgya 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas lo gcig lon na brgya 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after one year has passed, one will obtain a hundredfold result.

original: de snyed du brgyar bzlas na de snyed kyi brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de snyed du brgyar bzlas na de snyed kyi brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats it that many times, one will have that many hundreds.

original: de nas @31b stong du bzlas na yang stong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas @31b stong du bzlas na yang stong du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one repeats it a thousand times, one will have a thousand.

original: longs spyod dgug pa ni stong phrag brgyar bzlas so //
analyzed: longs spyod dgug pa ni stong phrag brgyar bzlas so //
translated: For summoning enjoyments, one should repeat it a hundred thousand times.

original: dgug pa ni rdo rje kyo btang gi phyag rgyas zla ba bzhis khugs so //
analyzed: dgug pa ni rdo rje kyo btang gi phyag rgyas zla ba bzhis khugs so //
translated: For summoning, one should summon with the Vajra Hook gesture in four months.

original: dbang du bya ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For enthralling, one should use the pledge seal of the Vajra Fist.

original: sems can thams cad gtan 'pho ba ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings te stong phrag brgyar bzlas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gtan 'pho ba ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings te stong phrag brgyar bzlas na /
translated: For causing all sentient beings to be transferred, one should bind the Vajra Hūṃkāra seal and repeat it a hundred thousand times.

original: sems can thams cad yid kyis dmigs pa bzhin gtan 'pho'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yid kyis dmigs pa bzhin gtan 'pho'o //
translated: All sentient beings will be transferred as one wishes.

original: chu gnon pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la chu'i steng du 'gror rung ba'i bar du bzlas //
analyzed: chu gnon pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la chu'i steng du 'gror rung ba'i bar du bzlas //
translated: For subduing water, one should bind the Vajra Fist seal and repeat it until one can walk on water.

original: me gnon pa ni thang cig bzlas pas so //
analyzed: me gnon pa ni thang cig bzlas pas so //
translated: For subduing fire, one should repeat it for a moment.

original: lo tog bsrung ba ni rdo rje lta bas te /
analyzed: lo tog bsrung ba ni rdo rje lta bas te /
translated: For protecting crops, one should use the Vajra Gaze.

original: de la srog chags rnams gang gis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la srog chags rnams gang gis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: No living being will be harmed by it.

original: byi ba la sogs pa yang 'da' bar mi byed do //
analyzed: byi ba la sogs pa yang 'da' bar mi byed do //
translated: Even mice and so forth will not pass over it.

original: rdeg pa spong ba ni khro bo'i lta bas te gang du bltas pa der 'pho'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa spong ba ni khro bo'i lta bas te gang du bltas pa der 'pho'o //
translated: Abandoning beating is by the wrathful gaze: wherever one looks, it will go there.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba thams cad spo ba ni 'bar ba'i lta bas ni rang gi snod du 'pho'o //🔽sdig pa dang / sbrul thams cad med par bya ba ni thang cig brjod pas so //
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba thams cad spo ba ni 'bar ba'i lta bas ni rang gi snod du 'pho'o // sdig pa dang / sbrul thams cad med par bya ba ni thang cig brjod pas so //
translated: Transference of all food and drink is by the blazing gaze: it will go into one’s own vessel.🔽All evil and snakes will be destroyed by reciting [the mantra] once.

original: gcan srin thams cad la thang cig bzlas pas med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcan srin thams cad la thang cig bzlas pas med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All carnivores will be destroyed by reciting [the mantra] once.

original: rkun po thams cad pham pa ni rdo rje khu tshur bcings pas so //
analyzed: rkun po thams cad pham pa ni rdo rje khu tshur bcings pas so //
translated: All thieves will be defeated by clenching one’s vajra fist.

original: dmag las sgrol ba ni rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dmag las sgrol ba ni rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: Deliverance from war is by the mudra of Vajradhara.

original: gzhu dang / mda' dang / mdung dang / rgyal mtshan mnan nas 'gul gyi bar du bzlas te /
analyzed: gzhu dang / mda' dang / mdung dang / rgyal mtshan mnan nas 'gul gyi bar du bzlas te /
translated: Having pressed down a bow, arrow, spear, or banner, one should recite [the mantra] until [the weapon] moves.

original: de thogs na dmag thams cad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thogs na dmag thams cad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes hold of it, one will be victorious over all armies.

original: zhal che la ni thang gcig brjod pas rtsod pa'i lan thebs par @32a *//🔽'gyur ro // zhi ba thams cad ni til gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: zhal che la ni thang gcig brjod pas rtsod pa'i lan thebs par @32a *// 'gyur ro // zhi ba thams cad ni til gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: In a court case, one will win the dispute by reciting [the mantra] once.🔽All pacifications are [accomplished] by an oblation of sesame seeds.

original: rgyas pa thams cad ni yungs kar gyi sbyin sreg gis so //🔽gtan 'pho ba thams cad ni tsher ma'i sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: rgyas pa thams cad ni yungs kar gyi sbyin sreg gis so // gtan 'pho ba thams cad ni tsher ma'i sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: All prosperities are [accomplished] by an oblation of white mustard seeds.🔽All expulsions are [accomplished] by an oblation of thorns.

original: gso ba thams cad ni nga'ur  ba'i lo ma'i sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: gso ba thams cad ni nga'ur  ba'i lo ma'i sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: All healing is [accomplished] by an oblation of leaves of the Indian pennywort.

original: 'tshe ba dang / gnam dal dang / rmi lam ngan pa thams cad gzhil ba ni til dang / 'bras kyi sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: 'tshe ba dang / gnam dal dang / rmi lam ngan pa thams cad gzhil ba ni til dang / 'bras kyi sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: All averting of harm, misfortune, and bad dreams is [accomplished] by an oblation of sesame seeds and rice.

original: gzhom pa thams cad ni h'um zhes pas so //
analyzed: gzhom pa thams cad ni h'um zhes pas so //
translated: All destroying is [accomplished] by [reciting] hūṃ.

original: dgod du gzhug ba dang / myos par bya ba thams cad la phags ces bya bas so //
analyzed: dgod du gzhug ba dang / myos par bya ba thams cad la phags ces bya bas so //
