translated: All causing to laugh and to become intoxicated is [accomplished] by [reciting] phaṭ.

original: thams cad gnyid log tu gzhug pa ni bskums la mig btsums te /
analyzed: thams cad gnyid log tu gzhug pa ni bskums la mig btsums te /
translated: All causing to fall asleep is [accomplished] by sitting cross-legged with one’s eyes closed.

original: brgya bzlas pas thams cad gnyid log par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: brgya bzlas pas thams cad gnyid log par byas pa yin no //
translated: By reciting [the mantra] one hundred times, all will fall asleep.

original: sems can thams cad rgyas gdab pa ni rdo rje khro bo'i lta bas bltas na rgyas btab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rgyas gdab pa ni rdo rje khro bo'i lta bas bltas na rgyas btab par 'gyur te /
translated: Sealing all sentient beings is sealing them by looking with the gaze of a wrathful vajra.

original: nyin bdun las lhag par mi gson no //
analyzed: nyin bdun las lhag par mi gson no //
translated: They will not live more than seven days.

original: ngag 'phrog ba ni rang gi lce sos bzung nas h'um zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyor ba bya'o //
analyzed: ngag 'phrog ba ni rang gi lce sos bzung nas h'um zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyor ba bya'o //
translated: Stealing speech is holding one’s tongue with one’s teeth and applying the syllable hūṃ.🔽Pulling out the heart is crossing one’s arms and

original: snying drang ba ni rdo rje sor mo'i phyag rgyas dpung ba bsnol te /
analyzed: snying drang ba ni rdo rje sor mo'i phyag rgyas dpung ba bsnol te /
translated: rolling around in one’s armpit with the vajra finger-seal.

original: rang gi mchan khung du glong zhing snying po bzlas na nub bdun tshun chad 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mchan khung du glong zhing snying po bzlas na nub bdun tshun chad 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats the essence mantra, the heart will be pulled out within seven nights.

original: snying bcad pa ni rdo rje blangs te gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: snying bcad pa ni rdo rje blangs te gcad par bya'o //
translated: Cutting the heart is taking the vajra and cutting it.

original: snying dbye ba ni rdo rje lcags phur gyis gdab ste /
analyzed: snying dbye ba ni rdo rje lcags phur gyis gdab ste /
translated: Splitting the heart is stabbing with the vajra dagger.

original: ming nas smos shing gzugs so //
analyzed: ming nas smos shing gzugs so //
translated: Recite the name and form.

original: snying spo ba ni lag pa gnyis kyis rdo rje blangs te mtshan bdun du rab tu sbyor ba byas pas 'pho bar 'gyur @32b ro //
analyzed: snying spo ba ni lag pa gnyis kyis rdo rje blangs te mtshan bdun du rab tu sbyor ba byas pas 'pho bar 'gyur @32b ro //
translated: Transplanting the heart is taking the vajra with both hands and applying it for seven nights. The heart will be transplanted.

original: de nas phyag rgya 'di rnams las thar bar bya ba bshad de //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya 'di rnams las thar bar bya ba bshad de //
translated: Next, the liberation from these seals is explained.

original: des rgyas 'debs pa la ni khu tshur dam pos so //
analyzed: des rgyas 'debs pa la ni khu tshur dam pos so //
translated: To seal them, do so with a tight fist.

original: ngag 'phrog pa la ni rdo rje ngag gis bzlas pas so //
analyzed: ngag 'phrog pa la ni rdo rje ngag gis bzlas pas so //
translated: To steal speech, do so with the vajra speech recitation.

original: snying 'dren pa la ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya snying gar dgrol lo //🔽bcad pa la ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa bzlas nas 'o mas khrus shig /
analyzed: snying 'dren pa la ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya snying gar dgrol lo // bcad pa la ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa bzlas nas 'o mas khrus shig /
translated: To draw out the heart, do so with the vajra fist gesture at the heart.🔽To cut, do so with the vajra hūṃ recitation and wash with milk.

original: phye ba la ni phur bu phyung nas rdo rje dris skus shig /
analyzed: phye ba la ni phur bu phyung nas rdo rje dris skus shig /
translated: To open, do so with the dagger drawn and the vajra staff.

original: snying spo ba la ni rdo rje snying pos thar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying spo ba la ni rdo rje snying pos thar bar bya'o //
translated: To transplant the heart, do so with the vajra heart.

original: de bzhin du byad ma'i phyag rgya yang spo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byad ma'i phyag rgya yang spo bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the magic spell is also transplanted.

original: snying bsgrub par 'dod na bud med kyi snying gar lta zhing lan gcig bzlas na de'i snying ga nas sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying bsgrub par 'dod na bud med kyi snying gar lta zhing lan gcig bzlas na de'i snying ga nas sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the heart, looking at the heart of a woman and reciting once, one will hear a sound from her heart.

original: skyes pa'i snying gar yang de bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i snying gar yang de bzhin du byas te /
translated: The same is done for the heart of a man.

original: snying ga thams cad du yang de ltar ro //
analyzed: snying ga thams cad du yang de ltar ro //
translated: The same is done for all hearts.

original: de nas pha rol gyi sems shes pa bsgrub par 'dod pas ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa brgyar bzlas na pha rol gyi sems shes so //
analyzed: de nas pha rol gyi sems shes pa bsgrub par 'dod pas ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa brgyar bzlas na pha rol gyi sems shes so //
translated: Then, one who wishes to accomplish the knowledge of the minds of others should repeat the vajra hūṃ one hundred times. One will know the minds of others.

original: sngon gyi gnas shes phar bya ba ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa bzlas pas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas shes phar bya ba ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa bzlas pas so //
translated: The knowledge of past abodes is accomplished by repeating the vajra hūṃ.

original: rmi lam mthong bar 'dod pas ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas shing bdug pas ka pi tsas bdugs te /
analyzed: rmi lam mthong bar 'dod pas ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas shing bdug pas ka pi tsas bdugs te /
translated: One who wishes to see dreams should repeat the vajra hūṃ twenty-one times and fumigate with the incense of olibanum.

original: gnyid log na de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi shes pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyid log na de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi shes pa ston to //
translated: If one goes to sleep, then the Blessed One will teach the knowledge of the past, future, and present.

original: tshig bsgrub par 'dod pas rdo rje tshig gi stong phrag brgya bzlas na rdo rje tshig gis rang gi lces smras pa thams cad bden par 'gyur te ci bslangs pa de stsol to //
analyzed: tshig bsgrub par 'dod pas rdo rje tshig gi stong phrag brgya bzlas na rdo rje tshig gis rang gi lces smras pa thams cad bden par 'gyur te ci bslangs pa de stsol to //
translated: One who wishes to accomplish speech should repeat the vajra speech one hundred thousand times. By the vajra speech, all that one says with one’s own tongue will be true, and one will be granted whatever one requests.

original: cho 'phrul ston pa ni bzlas pa'i rdo rje'i tshig gis @33a *//
analyzed: cho 'phrul ston pa ni bzlas pa'i rdo rje'i tshig gis @33a *//
translated: The display of miracles is accomplished by the vajra speech of repetition.

original: brgyad brgya bzlas na rang gi lus la cho 'phrul du 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rdo rje 'dzin dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du ston to //
analyzed: brgyad brgya bzlas na rang gi lus la cho 'phrul du 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rdo rje 'dzin dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du ston to //
translated: If one repeats it eight hundred times, one will display miracles in one’s body, in the form of all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, vajra holders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and so forth, in the manner of a reflection of all sentient beings.

original: rang gi gzugs ci dga' bar bsgyur bar byed 'dod pas rdo rje tshig gis rdo rje bzlas pa stong phrag brgya bzlas na gzugs gang dang / gang 'dod pa de dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su'ang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs ci dga' bar bsgyur bar byed 'dod pas rdo rje tshig gis rdo rje bzlas pa stong phrag brgya bzlas na gzugs gang dang / gang 'dod pa de dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su'ang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to transform one’s body into whatever one desires, one should repeat the vajra recitation one thousand times with the vajra speech. One will become whatever form one desires, and one will even become the form of the Buddha.

original: mi snang bar 'dod pas rdo rje khu tshur gyis rdo rje bzung la rdo rje bzung bas mi snang bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: mi snang bar 'dod pas rdo rje khu tshur gyis rdo rje bzung la rdo rje bzung bas mi snang bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: If one wishes to become invisible, one should hold the vajra with the vajra fist and repeat the mantra until one becomes invisible by holding the vajra.

original: btang bas ni dgrol lo //
analyzed: btang bas ni dgrol lo //
translated: If one releases it, one will become visible again.

original: khri'u la 'dug nas rdo rje lag tu blangs te /
analyzed: khri'u la 'dug nas rdo rje lag tu blangs te /
translated: If one sits on a bench and takes the vajra in one’s hand,

original: nam 'phar gyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: nam 'phar gyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: one should repeat the mantra until it levitates.

original: gdon gyis 'dzin du gzhug na rdo rje h'um zhes pas so //🔽gdon gar byed du 'jug pa ni hi zhes pas so //
analyzed: gdon gyis 'dzin du gzhug na rdo rje h'um zhes pas so // gdon gar byed du 'jug pa ni hi zhes pas so //
translated: If you want to possess someone with a spirit, do it with the vajra hūṃ.🔽If you want to make a spirit dance, do it with hi.

original: gdon bskyod pa ni hag ces pas so //
analyzed: gdon bskyod pa ni hag ces pas so //
translated: If you want to shake a spirit, do it with ha.

original: gdon gzhom pa ni phags ces pas so //
analyzed: gdon gzhom pa ni phags ces pas so //
translated: If you want to destroy a spirit, do it with phaṭ.

original: gcer bar bya ba ni mi'i skra'i skud pas rang gi dpung pa bcings na gcer bar 'gyur te gos brje bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcer bar bya ba ni mi'i skra'i skud pas rang gi dpung pa bcings na gcer bar 'gyur te gos brje bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you want to be naked, do it with a human hair rope tied around your arm: you will be naked and change clothes.

original: sdang bar bya ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dral bas so //
analyzed: sdang bar bya ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dral bas so //
translated: If you want to be hostile, do it with the pledge seal of the vajra fist.

original: bskrad pa ni rdo rje khu tshur gyis 'phang ngo //
analyzed: bskrad pa ni rdo rje khu tshur gyis 'phang ngo //
translated: If you want to expel, do it with the vajra fist.

original: dgos pa bskyed pa ni mtshan thog thag sha chen po rang gi khrag gis bskus te sreg go /
analyzed: dgos pa bskyed pa ni mtshan thog thag sha chen po rang gi khrag gis bskus te sreg go /
translated: If you want to generate the need, do it with a whole night of burning human flesh smeared with your own blood.

original: gzhan gyi bud med dgug pa ni @33b rdo rje bzung nas snying po bzlas shing dgug gam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med dgug pa ni @33b rdo rje bzung nas snying po bzlas shing dgug gam /
translated: If you want to summon another’s wife, do it with vajra-grasping, reciting the essence and summoning.

original: yang na thams cad du khyab pa h'um zhes pas thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad du khyab pa h'um zhes pas thams cad bya'o //
translated: Or else, do everything with hūṃ, which pervades everything.

original: bud med thams cad dang dga' bar spyod pa ni rang gi rtags rdo rje bcings pas bzung la nyin bdun dus gsum du langs kyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: bud med thams cad dang dga' bar spyod pa ni rang gi rtags rdo rje bcings pas bzung la nyin bdun dus gsum du langs kyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: The practice of all women: Having bound one’s own sign, the vajra, one should recite for seven days, three times a day, until one stands up.

original: de nas mjug tu nam phyed kyi bar du bzlas na rtag tu ldang la mi snyoms shing bcud mang la rtags shugs drag por 'gyur ro //🔽bu mo spyad pa ni rdo rje bzung nas thams cad du khyab par h'um zhes bya ba byas nas spyod do //🔽bud med thams cad dbang du bya ba ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings la stong phrag brgya bzlas na bud med thams cad mgu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mjug tu nam phyed kyi bar du bzlas na rtag tu ldang la mi snyoms shing bcud mang la rtags shugs drag por 'gyur ro // bu mo spyad pa ni rdo rje bzung nas thams cad du khyab par h'um zhes bya ba byas nas spyod do // bud med thams cad dbang du bya ba ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa'i phyag rgya bcings la stong phrag brgya bzlas na bud med thams cad mgu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, at the end, if one recites until midnight, one will always stand up, not fall down, and one’s strength and vigor will be greatly increased.🔽The practice of the girl: Having bound the vajra, one should practice everywhere, saying “hum.”🔽The practice of all women: Having bound the vajra-hum-kāra mudrā, if one recites one thousand times, all women will be pleased.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la stong phrag brgya bzlas na bud med thams cad mgu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la stong phrag brgya bzlas na bud med thams cad mgu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of Vajrapāṇi, having bound the Avalokiteśvara pledge mudrā, if one recites one thousand times, all women will be pleased.

original: sems can thams cad dbang du bya bar 'dod na rdo rje khu tshur gyi bcings pas rdo rje bzung la nam 'gul gyi bar du bzlas so /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du bya bar 'dod na rdo rje khu tshur gyi bcings pas rdo rje bzung la nam 'gul gyi bar du bzlas so /
translated: If one wishes to bring all sentient beings under one’s control, one should hold a vajra with the binding of the vajra fist and recite until one moves.

original: snang ba la dbang du bya bar 'dod na rdo rje blangs te rang gi spyi bor bzhag la spyi bor rdo rje brtan par gyur gyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: snang ba la dbang du bya bar 'dod na rdo rje blangs te rang gi spyi bor bzhag la spyi bor rdo rje brtan par gyur gyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: If one wishes to bring light under one’s control, one should take a vajra, place it on one’s crown, and recite until the vajra becomes firm on one’s crown.

original: de nas snang ba'i mdun du 'dug na des snang bar rang gi dbang bskur ba yang stsol to //
analyzed: de nas snang ba'i mdun du 'dug na des snang bar rang gi dbang bskur ba yang stsol to //
translated: Then, if one sits in front of the light, it will grant one the empowerment of light.

original: nor dgug pa ni rin po che'i gtso bo'i phye mas sbyin sreg byas pas so //🔽char dbab pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa stong bzlas pas so //🔽char gcad pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes pas so //
analyzed: nor dgug pa ni rin po che'i gtso bo'i phye mas sbyin sreg byas pas so // char dbab pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa stong bzlas pas so // char gcad pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes pas so //
translated: Summoning wealth is done by means of a fire offering with the powder of the chief of jewels.🔽Causing rain to fall is done by reciting the vajra hūṃ one thousand times.🔽Stopping rain is done with the vajra hūṃ.

original: @34a *// ser ba gcad pa ni rdo rje gsor ba'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: @34a *// ser ba gcad pa ni rdo rje gsor ba'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: Stopping hail is done with the vajra-hurling gesture.

original: gdon dgag pa yang phyag rgya de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gdon dgag pa yang phyag rgya de nyid kyis so //
translated: Stopping spirits is also done with that very gesture.

original: sprin dgag pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa brgyar bzlas pas so //
analyzed: sprin dgag pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa brgyar bzlas pas so //
translated: Stopping clouds is done by reciting the vajra hūṃ one hundred times.

original: bsal bal ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa lan brgyar bzlas so //
analyzed: bsal bal ni rdo rje h'um zhes pa lan brgyar bzlas so //
translated: For removing, recite the vajra hūṃ one hundred times.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhag nas me tog dang / bdug pas mchod de /
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhag nas me tog dang / bdug pas mchod de /
translated: Place it on top of the vajra maṇḍala, and make offerings with flowers and incense.

original: rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas mnan la rdo rje langs kyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas mnan la rdo rje langs kyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: Press it down with the mudra of Vajradhara and recite until the vajra rises.

original: de thogs nas sa bskor na ci 'dod pa bzhin du sgyu ma'i las rnams ston te /
analyzed: de thogs nas sa bskor na ci 'dod pa bzhin du sgyu ma'i las rnams ston te /
translated: If you then hold it and circle it, you will display illusory deeds just as you wish.

original: rdo rjes bskor bas dus ma yin par shing la 'bras bu dang / me tog mthong ngo //
analyzed: rdo rjes bskor bas dus ma yin par shing la 'bras bu dang / me tog mthong ngo //
translated: By circling with the vajra, you will see fruit and flowers on trees out of season.

original: nam mkha' la me tog gi phreng ba chags par bya ba ni dbugs bsdams la rdo rje khu tshur bcings te gtor na chags so //🔽cha lugs bzhad par bya ba ni rdo rje'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la me tog gi phreng ba chags par bya ba ni dbugs bsdams la rdo rje khu tshur bcings te gtor na chags so // cha lugs bzhad par bya ba ni rdo rje'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: To cause a garland of flowers to hang in the sky, bind the vajra fist and toss it while holding your breath; it will hang there.🔽To cause laughter, use the vajra mudra.

original: gar byed par bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin mas so //
analyzed: gar byed par bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin mas so //
translated: To cause dancing, use the Vajradhara mudra.

original: smra bar bya ba na h'um zhes pas so //
analyzed: smra bar bya ba na h'um zhes pas so //
translated: To cause speech, say hūṃ.

original: rgyug par bya na rdo rje dgug pa'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: rgyug par bya na rdo rje dgug pa'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: To cause running, use the vajra summoning mudra.

original: smin ma 'gul bar bya na rdo rje'i phyag rgya 'dzin pas rdo rje thogs la rang gi smin mtshams su bsgul bas so //
analyzed: smin ma 'gul bar bya na rdo rje'i phyag rgya 'dzin pas rdo rje thogs la rang gi smin mtshams su bsgul bas so //
translated: If you want to make your eyebrows move, hold the vajra fist and touch your eyebrows with the vajra.

original: sa g-yo bar bya na rkang pa g-yon pa brdabs pas so //🔽khyim bskul ba ni rdo rje dbab pa'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: sa g-yo bar bya na rkang pa g-yon pa brdabs pas so // khyim bskul ba ni rdo rje dbab pa'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: If you want to make the earth shake, stamp your left foot.🔽If you want to summon a house, use the vajra descent mudra.

original: khang pa dgug pa ni rdo rje khros pa'i kyo btang gi phyag rgya bcings pas so //
analyzed: khang pa dgug pa ni rdo rje khros pa'i kyo btang gi phyag rgya bcings pas so //
translated: If you want to summon a house, form the mudra of wrathful vajra hook.

original: sprin med par char pa dbab pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes bzlas pas so //
analyzed: sprin med par char pa dbab pa ni rdo rje h'um zhes bzlas pas so //
translated: If you want to make rain fall without clouds, recite vajra hūṃ.

original: skad cig tu sprin 'du @34b zhing ston pa ni rdo rje bskor bas so //
analyzed: skad cig tu sprin 'du @34b zhing ston pa ni rdo rje bskor bas so //
translated: If you want to gather and disperse clouds in an instant, rotate the vajra.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma dbab cing bstan pa ni rdo rje brdabs pas so //
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma dbab cing bstan pa ni rdo rje brdabs pas so //
translated: If you want to make the sun and moon rise and set, strike the vajra.

original: nyi ma dang / zla ba mang por bstan na /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla ba mang por bstan na /
translated: If you want to display many suns and moons,

original: rdo rje bzhi nam mkha' la gtor bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhi nam mkha' la gtor bas so //
translated: throw the four vajras into the sky.

original: dmag rnam bzhi bstan na rdo rje bskor bas so //
analyzed: dmag rnam bzhi bstan na rdo rje bskor bas so //
translated: If you want to display the four divisions of the army, rotate the vajra.

original: mtshan mo nyin par du bya na rdo rje 'bar ba bskor bas so //
analyzed: mtshan mo nyin par du bya na rdo rje 'bar ba bskor bas so //
translated: If you want to make night into day, rotate the blazing vajra.

original: nyin par mtshan mor bya na mig btsums la rdo rje bskor bas so //🔽thams cad nas rdo rje bstan na brgya bzlas te rdo rje bskor bas so //🔽thams cad nas byang chub sems dpa' bstan na stong bzlas te rdo rjes bskor bas so //🔽phyag na rdo rje thams cad ba la bstan na stong phrag brgya bzlas te bskor bas so //
analyzed: nyin par mtshan mor bya na mig btsums la rdo rje bskor bas so // thams cad nas rdo rje bstan na brgya bzlas te rdo rje bskor bas so // thams cad nas byang chub sems dpa' bstan na stong bzlas te rdo rjes bskor bas so // phyag na rdo rje thams cad ba la bstan na stong phrag brgya bzlas te bskor bas so //
translated: If one wishes to do it at night, one should close one’s eyes and rotate the vajra.🔽If one shows the vajra to all, one should recite one hundred times and rotate the vajra.🔽If one shows the bodhisattvas to all, one should recite one thousand times and rotate the vajra.🔽If one shows all the Vajrapāṇis, one should recite one hundred thousand times and rotate the vajra.

original: thams cad nas sangs rgyas bstan na rdo rje la bye ba bzlas pas so //🔽'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las /🔽rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i rtog pa chen po rdzogs so ////
analyzed: thams cad nas sangs rgyas bstan na rdo rje la bye ba bzlas pas so // 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las / rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i rtog pa chen po rdzogs so ////
translated: If one shows the buddhas to all, one should recite ten million times on the vajra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: From the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the King of the Tantras of Secret Wisdom, the Vajra of Delight, the Glorious Supreme Original Buddha, the Tantra of the Great King of the Secret Wisdom of the Vajra of Delight, the King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King of Tantras, the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Great King

original: ngas kyang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir gang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po 'dir brtson par 'gyur ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po 'di sbyin no //
analyzed: ngas kyang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir gang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po 'dir brtson par 'gyur ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po 'di sbyin no //
translated: I too will give this essence of all the Tathagatas to anyone who strives in this Great King of Mysteries, the Victorious in the Three Worlds, for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes /
translated: Then Vajrapani

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog por 'dug @35a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog por 'dug @35a *//
translated: bowed to the feet of the Blessed One and sat down on his haunches,

original: ste mnos pa /
analyzed: ste mnos pa /
translated: and received it.

original: h'um badzra bid sv'ah'a /
analyzed: h'um badzra bid sv'ah'a /
translated: Hum vajra vid svāhā.

original: de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rab tu g-yos so //
analyzed: de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rab tu g-yos so //
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, this great trichiliocosm shook.

original: sems can thams cad kyang rab tu g-yos nas phyag 'tshal zhing dbang du gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang rab tu g-yos nas phyag 'tshal zhing dbang du gyur to //
translated: All sentient beings also shook, paid homage, and became subject [to Vajrapani].

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas rdo rje rig pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas rdo rje rig pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di bshad do //
translated: Then the bodhisattva-mahāsattva Vajrapani, having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, explained this maṇḍala of the Vajra Knowledge.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du dkyil 'khor thams cad brtags te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du dkyil 'khor thams cad brtags te /
translated: Having visualized all the maṇḍalas in the manner of the great maṇḍala,

original: de'i dbus su nas phul bzhi la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te /
analyzed: de'i dbus su nas phul bzhi la bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te /
translated: the Bhagavān is in the center on a four-petaled lotus.

original: de'i spyan sngar phyag na rdo rje yid kyis kyang tsog tsog por bzhag go /🔽de nas de bzhin du gzhug go /
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar phyag na rdo rje yid kyis kyang tsog tsog por bzhag go / de nas de bzhin du gzhug go /
translated: In front of him, Vajrapāṇi is seated cross-legged.

original: zhugs nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhugs nas 'di skad du /
translated: Then, having entered in the same way, say this:

original: khyod deng nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyod deng nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do //
translated: “You are now a tathāgata.

original: de ste dad na de bshad do zhes bsgos shig /
analyzed: de ste dad na de bshad do zhes bsgos shig /
translated: If you have faith, it will be explained.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says,🔽“Please explain.”

original: gsungs shig ces pa dang / de nas khyod deng phan cad de bzhin gshegs par gyur to zhes smros shig /
analyzed: gsungs shig ces pa dang / de nas khyod deng phan cad de bzhin gshegs par gyur to zhes smros shig /
translated: Then say, “From now on, you have become a tathāgata.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says,🔽“Why?”

original: ci'i phyir / dkyil 'khor mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes des smros shig /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / dkyil 'khor mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes des smros shig /
translated: Say, “Because you have seen the maṇḍala.”

original: ras @43a *// kyi dbus su ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bri /
analyzed: ras @43a *// kyi dbus su ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bri /
translated: in the center of the cloth, one should draw the Blessed One, the Tathāgata.

original: de'i g-yas su phyag na rdo rje phyag bzhi ba'i thugs ka nas thugs 'byung ba de bzhin du bri /
analyzed: de'i g-yas su phyag na rdo rje phyag bzhi ba'i thugs ka nas thugs 'byung ba de bzhin du bri /
translated: To his right, one should draw Vajrapāṇi with four arms, with the mind-born mind at his heart.

original: g-yon du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po phyag bzhi ba ste /
analyzed: g-yon du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po phyag bzhi ba ste /
translated: To the left, one should draw Avalokiteśvara with four arms.

original: gnyis na ni padmo'i ting nge 'dzin 'chang /
analyzed: gnyis na ni padmo'i ting nge 'dzin 'chang /
translated: In two [hands], he holds a lotus and samādhi.

original: gnyis kyis ni me tog gi gzhu 'gengs pa /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni me tog gi gzhu 'gengs pa /
translated: With two, he draws a flower bow.

original: kha dog dmar po bri //
analyzed: kha dog dmar po bri //
translated: He is drawn red in color.

original: spyan sngar de bzhin du rdo rje 'dod pa'i khro bo bri'o //
analyzed: spyan sngar de bzhin du rdo rje 'dod pa'i khro bo bri'o //
translated: In front, one should draw Vajrarāga, the wrathful one, just like that.

original: steng du nam mkha'i snying bo bri /
analyzed: steng du nam mkha'i snying bo bri /
translated: Above, one should draw Ākāśagarbha.

original: grvar mchod pa'i lha rang gi mchod pas 'gram pa dang mgo bor ro //
analyzed: grvar mchod pa'i lha rang gi mchod pas 'gram pa dang mgo bor ro //
translated: In the corners, one should draw the offering goddesses with one's own offerings, at the sides and above the head.

original: de nas ras la bris pa'i spyan sngar zla ba bzhin dus bzhir stong bzlas shing bsgrubs na de nas zla ba tshang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'ang stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ras la bris pa'i spyan sngar zla ba bzhin dus bzhir stong bzlas shing bsgrubs na de nas zla ba tshang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'ang stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in front of the painted cloth, one should practice for four months, reciting one thousand times each day. Then, when the month is complete, even the Tathāgatas will be granted.

original: ras la bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bris la /
analyzed: ras la bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bris la /
translated: One should paint the Blessed One in the form of a maṇḍala.

original: sems dpa' chen po dang / lha mo yang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po dang / lha mo yang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The great being and the goddess should also be painted in the same way.

original: de'i spyan sngar zla ba gcig tu grangs med par bzlas shing 'dod pa thams cad zos la bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar zla ba gcig tu grangs med par bzlas shing 'dod pa thams cad zos la bsgrubs te /
translated: In front of that, one should practice for one month, reciting the mantra countless times, and eating all the desired substances.

original: de nas zla ba gcig lon pa dang / phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa /
analyzed: de nas zla ba gcig lon pa dang / phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa /
translated: Then, when one month has passed, one should form the great mudrā of Vajrapāṇi,

original: mtshan thal byung bzlas na nang bar rdo rje 'dzin 'thob po //
analyzed: mtshan thal byung bzlas na nang bar rdo rje 'dzin 'thob po //
translated: and recite the mantra until dawn. One will obtain the state of a vajra-holder.

original: ras la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje de bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: ras la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje de bzhin du bris la /
translated: One should paint the Blessed Vajrapāṇi in the same way.

original: de'i spyan sngar zla ba phyed kyi bar du rtag par bzlas pa ni mi nyal mi mnal bar bzlas te /
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar zla ba phyed kyi bar du rtag par bzlas pa ni mi nyal mi mnal bar bzlas te /
translated: In front of that, one should recite the mantra continuously for half a month, without sleeping or lying down.

original: de nas zla ba phyed lon pa dang / mtshan mo yang thal @43b byung du bzlas na nang bar phyag na rdo rje dang mtshungs pa dang / 'dod pa'i longs spyod chen po dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba thams cad kyang 'thob cing thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas zla ba phyed lon pa dang / mtshan mo yang thal @43b byung du bzlas na nang bar phyag na rdo rje dang mtshungs pa dang / 'dod pa'i longs spyod chen po dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba thams cad kyang 'thob cing thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after half a month, if one recites at night until dawn, one will become equal to Vajrapāṇi in the morning, and one will obtain all the great enjoyments of desire, happiness, and mental ease, and one will go everywhere.

original: ras la bcom ldan 'das khro bo de bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: ras la bcom ldan 'das khro bo de bzhin du bris la /
translated: One should draw the Blessed One, the Wrathful One, on cloth,

original: de'i spyan sngar rdo rje shugs kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar rdo rje shugs kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: and in front of him one should form the mudrā of Vajra Speed.

original: stong phrag brgya bzlas na des 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong phrag brgya bzlas na des 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times, one will accomplish it.

original: bsgo ba bzhin du las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: bsgo ba bzhin du las thams cad byed do //
translated: One will do all the activities as commanded.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du'ang khyed zhing slar yang khyer te 'ong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du'ang khyed zhing slar yang khyer te 'ong ngo //
translated: One will be able to carry one to all the buddhafields and bring one back again.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba thams cad khyer te 'ongs nas de la sbyin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba thams cad khyer te 'ongs nas de la sbyin no //
translated: One will bring all the enjoyments of desire from all the buddhafields and give them to one.

original: des kyang longs spyod par nus na lha'i bu mo thams cad lta ci smos /
analyzed: des kyang longs spyod par nus na lha'i bu mo thams cad lta ci smos /
translated: If one is able to enjoy them, what need is there to mention all the celestial maidens?

original: brgya byin yang stsol to //
analyzed: brgya byin yang stsol to //
translated: Śakra will also grant it.

original: phyag na rdo rje 'dzin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du bsgo bas stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje 'dzin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du bsgo bas stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the holder of the vajra in the hand up to the Buddha, it will be granted by order.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug ste dbang du byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug ste dbang du byed do //
translated: If one repeats it one hundred thousand times in front of the Buddha, all the Tathāgatas will be summoned and brought under control.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rdo rje thugs kyi phyag rgya bcings nas stong phrag brgya bzlas na /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rdo rje thugs kyi phyag rgya bcings nas stong phrag brgya bzlas na /
translated: In front of Vajrapāṇi, having formed the vajra mind seal, one should repeat it one hundred thousand times.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje nyid kyi dpal gyi lha mo khrid de byon nas sgrub pa po'i mdun du 'dor ro //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje nyid kyi dpal gyi lha mo khrid de byon nas sgrub pa po'i mdun du 'dor ro //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi himself, leading the glorious goddess, will come and descend in front of the practitioner.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos bcom ldan 'das khyod nyid bdag gis grub par 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos bcom ldan 'das khyod nyid bdag gis grub par 'tshal gyi /
translated: Then the practitioner should say, “Blessed One, I seek accomplishment from you.

original: 'di ci 'tshal zhes smros shig /
analyzed: 'di ci 'tshal zhes smros shig /
translated: What is the use of this?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dgyes te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dgyes te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, delighted,

original: ci 'dod pa'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will grant the supreme desired object.

original: grub pa thams cad kyang 'grub po //
analyzed: grub pa thams cad kyang 'grub po //
translated: All accomplishments will be accomplished.

original: @44a *// spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na spyan ras gzigs dbang pos mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @44a *// spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na spyan ras gzigs dbang pos mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of Avalokiteśvara, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, Avalokiteśvara will grant the supreme [achievement].

original: nam mkha'i snying bo'i spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na dbang stsol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying bo'i spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na dbang stsol bar 'gyur te /
translated: In front of Ākāśagarbha, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, he will grant power,

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do //
translated: and will accomplish all wishes.

original: rdo rje bzhag ste de'i mdun du 'bum bzlas na de nas las thams cad yid bzhin du grub par byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhag ste de'i mdun du 'bum bzlas na de nas las thams cad yid bzhin du grub par byed do //
translated: Placing the vajra in front of him, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, then he will accomplish all activities as desired.

original: phyag rgya chen po bcings nas 'bum bzlas na phyag na rdo rje 'dzin gyis mchog stsol to //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bcings nas 'bum bzlas na phyag na rdo rje 'dzin gyis mchog stsol to //
translated: Binding the great seal, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, Vajrapāṇi will grant the supreme [achievement].

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na rdo rje 'dzin mngon du mthong zhing phyag rgya'i las kun grub pa yang stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na rdo rje 'dzin mngon du mthong zhing phyag rgya'i las kun grub pa yang stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Binding the pledge seal, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, Vajradhara will appear and will grant the accomplishment of all seal activities.

original: rdo rje lag tu thogs nas 'bum bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur gyis rdo rje bzung btsam gyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje lag tu thogs nas 'bum bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur gyis rdo rje bzung btsam gyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking hold of the vajra in one’s hand, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, by merely holding the vajra with the vajra fist, one will become invisible.

original: 'khor lo thogs te /
analyzed: 'khor lo thogs te /
translated: Taking hold of the wheel,

original: 'bum bzlas na 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas na 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times, one will become a wheel-holder vidyādhara.

original: kyo btang thogs te 'bum bzlas na /
analyzed: kyo btang thogs te 'bum bzlas na /
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times while holding a goad,

original: kyo btang des thams cad 'gugs nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyo btang des thams cad 'gugs nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will be able to summon all with that goad.

original: zhags pa thogs te 'bum bzlas na zhags pa des thams cad drang nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhags pa thogs te 'bum bzlas na zhags pa des thams cad drang nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times while holding a noose, one will be able to lead all with that noose.

original: lag pa gnyis rdo rjes bcings pa bsdams te /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis rdo rjes bcings pa bsdams te /
translated: One should bind one’s two hands in vajra fists

original: 'bum bzlas na sems can thams cad bcing nus par 'gyur //🔽rdo rje dbang pa'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dbang @44b nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas na sems can thams cad bcing nus par 'gyur // rdo rje dbang pa'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dbang @44b nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: and recite one hundred thousand times. One will be able to bind all sentient beings.🔽If one binds the mudrā of the powerful vajra and recites one hundred thousand times, one will be able to enthrall all beings and bring them under one’s power.

original: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na h'um zhes bya ba gcig gi gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad skad cig gis ltung bar byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na h'um zhes bya ba gcig gi gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad skad cig gis ltung bar byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one binds the mudrā of the vajra hūṃ and recites one hundred thousand times, one will be able to cause all beings to fall in an instant with a single hūṃ.

original: lha chen po rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na /
analyzed: lha chen po rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'bum bzlas na /
translated: Having pressed down the great god with the left foot, and formed the mudra of total victory over the three worlds, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times,

original: zla ba gcig tshun chad kyis der 'ongs te dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tshun chad kyis der 'ongs te dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: he will come within one month and be under one's control.

original: mthu bo che rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te 'bum bzlas na 'khor lo thob ste /
analyzed: mthu bo che rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te 'bum bzlas na 'khor lo thob ste /
translated: Having pressed down Mahêśvara with the left foot and repeated [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, one will obtain a cakra.

original: 'khor lo de thogs na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo de thogs na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes up that cakra, one will be successful.

original: tshangs pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na tshangs par spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na tshangs par spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having pressed down Brahmā and repeated [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, one will become a celibate.

original: brgya byin rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te 'bum bzlas na rdo rje sbyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgya byin rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te 'bum bzlas na rdo rje sbyin par 'gyur te /
translated: Having pressed down Śakra with the left foot and repeated [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, one will obtain a vajra.

original: rdo rje bskor bas tshar bcad pa dang / dbab pa dang / thang cig gis ni gnam lcags dang / ser ba 'bebs so //
analyzed: rdo rje bskor bas tshar bcad pa dang / dbab pa dang / thang cig gis ni gnam lcags dang / ser ba 'bebs so //
translated: By brandishing that vajra, one will be able to destroy, bring down, and in an instant cause lightning and hail.

original: sa nad gzhon nu mnan te 'bum bzlas na /
analyzed: sa nad gzhon nu mnan te 'bum bzlas na /
translated: Having pressed down the young earth goddess and repeated [the mantra] one hundred thousand times,

original: gzhon nu ma thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become the lord of all young goddesses.

original: las thams cad kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las thams cad kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will also be able to perform all activities.

original: nyi ma la bltas te 'bum bzlas na bdud rtsi rna cha sbyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi ma la bltas te 'bum bzlas na bdud rtsi rna cha sbyin par 'gyur te /
translated: If one gazes at the sun and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will obtain nectar earrings.

original: des na lha'i lo stong 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na lha'i lo stong 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of them, one will live for one thousand celestial years.

original: zla ba la 'bar ba'i lta bas mgu bar bltas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na zla ba gnyis su mthong ste /
analyzed: zla ba la 'bar ba'i lta bas mgu bar bltas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na zla ba gnyis su mthong ste /
translated: If one gazes at the moon with a blazing gaze and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will see two moons.

original: de phyin chad zla ba dang mtshungs pa'i 'od dang mdangs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyin chad zla ba dang mtshungs pa'i 'od dang mdangs su 'gyur te /
translated: From then on, one will have a radiance and complexion equal to the moon.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mig tu mdzes shing sems @45a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mig tu mdzes shing sems @45a *//
translated: One will be beautiful in the eyes of all sentient beings.

original: can thams cad kyi snying du sdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: can thams cad kyi snying du sdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be dear to the heart of all sentient beings.

original: gza' chen po'i gzugs la bltas te 'bum bzlas na de nas be con thob ste /
analyzed: gza' chen po'i gzugs la bltas te 'bum bzlas na de nas be con thob ste /
translated: If one gazes at the form of a great planet and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will then obtain a club.

original: pe con des ni 'thabs na dgra las rgyal te nor thams cad 'thob po //🔽skya sleng gi gnas su song ste /
analyzed: pe con des ni 'thabs na dgra las rgyal te nor thams cad 'thob po // skya sleng gi gnas su song ste /
translated: By means of that club, if one fights, one will be victorious over one’s enemies and obtain all wealth.

original: 'bum bzlas na skya sleng las kun byed do //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas na skya sleng las kun byed do //
translated: If one goes to the abode of the yakṣas and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will be able to do everything for the yakṣas.

original: rgyun gyis myos pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na tshed  gi snod thams cad nam 'tsho'i bar du mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyis myos pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na tshed  gi snod thams cad nam 'tsho'i bar du mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one suppresses the intoxicated one with the continuous [mantra] and repeats [it] a hundred thousand times, all the vessels of the house will not be exhausted for as long as one lives.

original: ma dh'u ka ra la bltas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na dbang bskur ba thob par 'gyur ro //🔽rgyal ba la bltas te 'bum bzlas na 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa'i g-yul thams cad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma dh'u ka ra la bltas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na dbang bskur ba thob par 'gyur ro // rgyal ba la bltas te 'bum bzlas na 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa'i g-yul thams cad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at the king and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will obtain consecration.🔽If one looks at the victor and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will be victorious in all battles and disputes.

original: rgyal ba thob pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na thams cad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba thob pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na thams cad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one suppresses the victorious one and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will be victorious over all.

original: mdzod skyong rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te 'bum bzlas na bza' ba dang / btung ba mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdzod skyong rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te 'bum bzlas na bza' ba dang / btung ba mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one suppresses the treasure-protector with the left foot and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one's food and drink will be inexhaustible.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyis kyang 'di la zad par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyis kyang 'di la zad par mi nus so //
translated: Even all beings will not be able to exhaust it.

original: rlung mngon du byas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na rlung gis de dang mthun par 'dod pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung mngon du byas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na rlung gis de dang mthun par 'dod pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes the wind manifest and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, the wind will do all that is desired in accordance with that.

original: me la bltas te 'bum bzlas na me'i dbus su 'dug ba dang / nyal ba dang / 'gro na yang mi 'tshig ste me'i gzir gyur cing nyin gcig kyang gser srang re re sbyin no //
analyzed: me la bltas te 'bum bzlas na me'i dbus su 'dug ba dang / nyal ba dang / 'gro na yang mi 'tshig ste me'i gzir gyur cing nyin gcig kyang gser srang re re sbyin no //
translated: If one looks at a fire and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will be able to sit, lie down, and walk in the middle of the fire without being burned. One will be able to live in the fire, and will receive one ounce of gold every day.

original: ngal gsos po mnan te 'bum bzlas na gnod sbyin thams @45b cad kyi bdag por gyur nas nor thams cad kyang sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngal gsos po mnan te 'bum bzlas na gnod sbyin thams @45b cad kyi bdag por gyur nas nor thams cad kyang sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one subdues the yakṣa Pūtanā and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will become the lord of all yakṣas, and they will give one all their wealth.

original: phag mo mngon du byas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na sa la 'dug pa'i gter 'byin no //
analyzed: phag mo mngon du byas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na sa la 'dug pa'i gter 'byin no //
translated: If one subdues the female pig and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will reveal the treasure buried in the ground.

original: gshin rje mnan te 'bum bzlas na mi 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gshin rje mnan te 'bum bzlas na mi 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one subdues Yama and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will become immortal.

original: gnam 'dren pa'i cha lugs la bltas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na de las thams cad pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnam 'dren pa'i cha lugs la bltas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na de las thams cad pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at the form of Indra and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will become the servant of all his activities.

original: klu ba ru na mnan te 'bum bzlas na klu thams cad las kun byed pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu ba ru na mnan te 'bum bzlas na klu thams cad las kun byed pa'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one subdues the nāga Varuna and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will become the servant of all nāgas, doing all their work.

original: mi'i gnas su song nas stong phrag brgya bzlas na mi thams cad g-yog byed cing don thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i gnas su song nas stong phrag brgya bzlas na mi thams cad g-yog byed cing don thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having gone to a human dwelling, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, all humans will become one's servants and will do all that is to be done.

original: sa la 'dug ste 'bum bzlas na sa'i dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la 'dug ste 'bum bzlas na sa'i dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while sitting on the ground, one will become the lord of the earth.

original: nam mkha' la bltas te 'bum bzlas na nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i sems can thams cad bsgyel ba dang / dbang byed par 'gyur zhing nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la bltas te 'bum bzlas na nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i sems can thams cad bsgyel ba dang / dbang byed par 'gyur zhing nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while looking at the sky, all beings who move in the sky will be brought down and controlled, and one will be able to move in the sky.

original: sa'i 'og mngon du byas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na sa'i 'og na 'khod pa kun la dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i 'og mngon du byas te stong phrag brgya bzlas na sa'i 'og na 'khod pa kun la dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while facing downward, one will gain control over all those who dwell below the earth.

original: rin po che thogs te 'bum bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rin po che thogs te 'bum bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while holding a jewel, it will increase a hundred thousand times.

original: gser gyi dong tse la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi dong tse la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to golden coins and so forth.

original: skyes pa bzung ste 'bum bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa bzung ste 'bum bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while holding a man, he will increase a hundred thousand times.

original: bud med bzung ste stong phrag brgya bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med bzung ste stong phrag brgya bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes hold of a woman and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, she will increase a hundred thousandfold.

original: rta la zhon te 'bum bzlas na 'bum du @46a *//🔽'phel bar 'gyur ro //🔽glang po che la zhon te 'bum bzlas na 'bum du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rta la zhon te 'bum bzlas na 'bum du @46a *// 'phel bar 'gyur ro // glang po che la zhon te 'bum bzlas na 'bum du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times while riding a horse, [the horse] will increase a hundred thousandfold.🔽If one repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times while riding an elephant, [the elephant] will increase a hundred thousandfold.

original: ba lang la sogs pa phyugs kyi rva gnyis bzung te 'bum bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa phyugs kyi rva gnyis bzung te 'bum bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes hold of the two horns of cattle such as cows and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, they will increase a hundred thousandfold.

original: gos dang / rgyan gyi chas la stong phrag brgyar bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos dang / rgyan gyi chas la stong phrag brgyar bzlas na stong phrag brgyar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times while wearing clothes and ornaments, they will increase a hundred thousandfold.

original: dpal mo la bltas te 'bum bzlas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal mo la bltas te 'bum bzlas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gazes at Śrīdevī and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, she will come under one's control.

original: mtsho dbyangs ma la bltas te 'bum bzlas na tshig rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtsho dbyangs ma la bltas te 'bum bzlas na tshig rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gazes at Sarasvatī and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one's speech will be purified.

original: de nas bslangs na ci bslangs pa de kun ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bslangs na ci bslangs pa de kun ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one requests anything, it will all be given.

original: gtsug lag thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will know all the scriptures and all consciousnesses.

original: grub byed ma bzung nas 'bum bzlas na 'das pa dang / da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa kun kyang ston cing ched du ma bslangs bar nor sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub byed ma bzung nas 'bum bzlas na 'das pa dang / da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa kun kyang ston cing ched du ma bslangs bar nor sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pressing down on Siddhabhadrā, she will reveal the past, present, and future, and will give wealth without being asked.

original: s'a la bha nytsa tsi ka mnan nas 'bum bzlas na nyin re bzhin yang gser gyi dong tse brgyad brgyad ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: s'a la bha nytsa tsi ka mnan nas 'bum bzlas na nyin re bzhin yang gser gyi dong tse brgyad brgyad ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pressing down on a sālabhañjikā, she will give eight hundred gold coins every day.

original: gos gyi sgrogs la mnan te 'bum bzlas na mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos gyi sgrogs la mnan te 'bum bzlas na mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pressing down on a piece of cloth, it will become inexhaustible.

original: gang dang / gang gi snod mnan te 'bum bzlas na de dang / de mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang / gang gi snod mnan te 'bum bzlas na de dang / de mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever vessel one presses down on and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times over, that will become inexhaustible.

original: gnod sbyin gyi cha lugs mnan te 'bum bzlas na gnod sbyin gyis ci dang / ci 'dod pa kun sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi cha lugs mnan te 'bum bzlas na gnod sbyin gyis ci dang / ci 'dod pa kun sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pressing down on a yakṣa’s form, the yakṣa will give whatever one desires.

original: srin po mnan te 'bum bzlas na de de'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srin po mnan te 'bum bzlas na de de'i g-yog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pressing down on a rākṣasa, it will become one’s servant.

original: @46b 'byung po mnan te 'bum bzlas na 'byung po thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @46b 'byung po mnan te 'bum bzlas na 'byung po thams cad kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pressing down on a bhūta, one will become the lord of all bhūtas.

original: sha za'i cha lugs bris pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na de de'i g-yog byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha za'i cha lugs bris pa mnan te 'bum bzlas na de de'i g-yog byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one draws the form of a piśāca and suppresses it, and repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, he will become one’s servant.

original: de bzhin du gnod sbyin ma la sogs pa yang bsgrub bo //🔽ri la 'jegs te 'bum bzlas na ri thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod sbyin ma la sogs pa yang bsgrub bo // ri la 'jegs te 'bum bzlas na ri thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one should practice with yakṣiṇīs and so forth.🔽If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while standing on a mountain, all mountains will be under one’s control.

original: phyugs kyi lhas su 'dug te 'bum bzlas na phyugs thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyugs kyi lhas su 'dug te 'bum bzlas na phyugs thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while staying in a cow pen, all cattle will be under one’s control.

original: shing ljon gyi drung du 'bum bzlas na shing ljon pa'i lha rnams mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing ljon gyi drung du 'bum bzlas na shing ljon pa'i lha rnams mchog sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times in front of a tree, the tree spirits will grant boons.

original: zhing la 'dug te 'bum bzlas na bza' ba 'bum du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhing la 'dug te 'bum bzlas na bza' ba 'bum du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while staying in a field, one’s food will increase one hundred thousandfold.

original: tshong pa dang bcas pa'i grong du 'bum bzlas na nor thams cad ma bslangs par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshong pa dang bcas pa'i grong du 'bum bzlas na nor thams cad ma bslangs par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times in a town with merchants, one will obtain all wealth without having to ask for it.

original: zhing la 'dug te 'bum bzlas na thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhing la 'dug te 'bum bzlas na thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times while staying in a field, one will have control over everything.

original: grong du 'bum bzlas na zla ba gcig tshun chad kyis grong de thob bo //
analyzed: grong du 'bum bzlas na zla ba gcig tshun chad kyis grong de thob bo //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times in a town, within one month one will obtain that town.

original: gtsug lag khang du 'bum bzlas na gtsug lag khang na gnas pas nor thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du 'bum bzlas na gtsug lag khang na gnas pas nor thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in a temple, all the wealth of the temple will be given to one by the resident deities.

original: lha'i rten du 'bum bzlas na lhas nor thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i rten du 'bum bzlas na lhas nor thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in a shrine, all the wealth of the shrine will be given to one by the deities.

original: khang pa stong par 'bum bzlas na sha za thams cad de'i g-yog tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: khang pa stong par 'bum bzlas na sha za thams cad de'i g-yog tu 'gyur te /
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in an empty house, all the piśācas will become one’s servants.

original: dgos pa thams cad sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa thams cad sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will do all that one asks.

original: snang ba'i gnas su 'bum bzlas na snang ba dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽skyed mos tshal du 'bum bzlas na skyed mos tshal @47a *//
analyzed: snang ba'i gnas su 'bum bzlas na snang ba dbang du 'gyur ro // skyed mos tshal du 'bum bzlas na skyed mos tshal @47a *//
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in a place where there is light, the light will come under one’s control.

original: gyi me tog dang / 'bras bu thams cad rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyi me tog dang / 'bras bu thams cad rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in a garden, all the flowers and fruits in the garden will always appear.

original: mtshor 'bum bzlas na mtsho de'i lha la dbang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshor 'bum bzlas na mtsho de'i lha la dbang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times on the bank of a lake, one will become the master of the deity of that lake.

original: gter gyi gnas su 'bum bzlas na gter rang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gter gyi gnas su 'bum bzlas na gter rang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in a place where there is treasure, the treasure will appear by itself.

original: dgod cing 'bum bzlas na rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgod cing 'bum bzlas na rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while laughing, one will always be happy.

original: bgad ba tsam gyis las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgad ba tsam gyis las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By just laughing, one will accomplish all activities.

original: khros pas 'bum bzlas na thams cad gtan 'pho bar nus par 'gyur ro //🔽cang mi zer bar 'bum bzlas na sems can thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khros pas 'bum bzlas na thams cad gtan 'pho bar nus par 'gyur ro // cang mi zer bar 'bum bzlas na sems can thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while angry, one will be able to kill everyone.🔽If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times without speaking, one will enthrall all beings.

original: lkugs pa'i brtul zhugs kyi 'bum bzlas na tshig thams cad kyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lkugs pa'i brtul zhugs kyi 'bum bzlas na tshig thams cad kyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while observing a vow of silence, one will enthrall all speech.

original: bud med kyi 'jom par rtags btsugs te /
analyzed: bud med kyi 'jom par rtags btsugs te /
translated: One should plant a stake in the ground in front of a woman

original: 'bum bzlas na 'dod pa thams cad kyi bdag po dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'gro ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas na 'dod pa thams cad kyi bdag po dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'gro ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times. One will become the lord of all pleasures and will fly through space.

original: 'jom pa la mdzub mo btsugs te 'bum bzlas na de byas pas gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad 'dren cing 'gugs pa dang / gtong ba dang / 'gyel ba dang / slong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jom pa la mdzub mo btsugs te 'bum bzlas na de byas pas gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad 'dren cing 'gugs pa dang / gtong ba dang / 'gyel ba dang / slong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while pointing at the stake, one will be able to move, summon, dismiss, and throw down all beings and spirits.

original: 'jom pa lta zhing 'bum bzlas na bud med thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jom pa lta zhing 'bum bzlas na bud med thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while looking at the stake, all women will be delighted.

original: 'jom par lig bu mig bcug ste 'bum bzlas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jom par lig bu mig bcug ste 'bum bzlas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while placing antimony in the stake, one will become invisible.

original: 'jom par gur gum bskus te 'bum bzlas na des bskus pas 'dod pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jom par gur gum bskus te 'bum bzlas na des bskus pas 'dod pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one anoints oneself with the ashes of a corpse, and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will become the form of the one who was cremated.

original: 'jom par ba  bla bcug ste 'bum @47b bzlas na nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jom par ba  bla bcug ste 'bum @47b bzlas na nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts ashes in one’s mouth and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will be able to fly through the sky.

original: 'jom par ldong ros bcug ste 'bum bzlas na rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //🔽ral gri thogs te 'bum bzlas na ral gri can gyi rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jom par ldong ros bcug ste 'bum bzlas na rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro // ral gri thogs te 'bum bzlas na ral gri can gyi rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts realgar in one’s mouth and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will become a vidyādhara.🔽If one holds a sword and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will become a vidyādhara with a sword.

original: 'khor lo thogs te 'bum bzlas na 'khor lo can gyi rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo thogs te 'bum bzlas na 'khor lo can gyi rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds a discus and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will become a vidyādhara with a discus.

original: kyo btang thogs te 'bum bzlas na kyo btang des thams cad 'gugs nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyo btang thogs te 'bum bzlas na kyo btang des thams cad 'gugs nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds a goad and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will be able to summon all with that goad.

original: rdo rje gsor nas stong phrag brgya bzlas na rdo rje rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gsor nas stong phrag brgya bzlas na rdo rje rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one brandishes a vajra and recites the mantra one thousand times, one will become a vajra-vidyādhara.

original: phyag na rdo rje lag gi bzung nas 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje lag gi bzung nas 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds a vajra in one’s hand and recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will become a vajra-holder vidyādhara of all the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la lag gis bzung ste 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la lag gis bzung ste 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi rig 'dzin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while holding the Tathāgata with one’s hand, one will become a master of the sacred Dharma who makes offerings to all the Tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran zhing 'bum bzlas na sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran zhing 'bum bzlas na sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while recollecting the Buddha, one will succeed in seeing all the Buddhas.

original: phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal zhing 'bum bzlas na phyag na rdo rjes kyang de mchod na gzhan gyi lta ci smos /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal zhing 'bum bzlas na phyag na rdo rjes kyang de mchod na gzhan gyi lta ci smos /
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while paying homage to Vajrapāṇi, Vajrapāṇi himself will make offerings to one, let alone others.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs las bzung ste 'bum bzlas na ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs las bzung ste 'bum bzlas na ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while holding the feet of Avalokiteśvara, one will attain meditative absorption.

original: rdo rje snying po bzung nas 'bum bzlas na nor thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po bzung nas 'bum bzlas na nor thams cad sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while holding the vajra essence, one will obtain all wealth.

original: rdo rje khu tshur bcangs la rdo rje khu tshur gyi spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na khu tshur bsdams pa tsam gyis las kun byed nus par @48a *//
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur bcangs la rdo rje khu tshur gyi spyan sngar 'bum bzlas na khu tshur bsdams pa tsam gyis las kun byed nus par @48a *//
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times in front of Vajramuṣṭi while making a vajra fist, one will be able to perform all activities merely by clenching one’s fist.

original: 'gyur ro // 'jam dpal gzhon nu la lta zhing 'bum bzlas na nam mkha' la yi ge snang ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'jam dpal gzhon nu la lta zhing 'bum bzlas na nam mkha' la yi ge snang ste /
translated: If one looks at Mañjuśrī, the divine youth, and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, the syllables will appear in the sky.

original: thams cad smra ba dang / spobs pa thogs pa med par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad smra ba dang / spobs pa thogs pa med par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain eloquence and the ability to speak about everything.

original: sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bskor zhing 'bum bzlas na dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bskor zhing 'bum bzlas na dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at the bodhisattva Akṣayamati and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will enter all maṇḍalas.

original: nam mkha'i mdzod la bltas te 'bum bzlas na nam mkha' la rgyu ba thams cad dang / don thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa thams cad kyi bar du ston to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mdzod la bltas te 'bum bzlas na nam mkha' la rgyu ba thams cad dang / don thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa thams cad kyi bar du ston to //
translated: If one looks at Ākāśagarbha and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, all that moves in the sky, all objects, and all buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so forth will be revealed.

original: byams pa'i zhabs la bzung ste 'bum bzlas na mtho ris kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba thams cad nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byams pa'i zhabs la bzung ste 'bum bzlas na mtho ris kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba thams cad nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at Maitreya and repeats [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, one will experience all the pleasures of the heavens.

original: dkyil 'khor bris nas 'bum bzlas na dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bdag po slob dpon dang / yid kyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bris nas 'bum bzlas na dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bdag po slob dpon dang / yid kyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala and recited [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, one will become a master of all maṇḍalas, and all that one imagines will be accomplished.

original: dkyil 'khor chen por brtags te zhugs nas 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rdo rje 'dzin dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen por brtags te zhugs nas 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rdo rje 'dzin dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered the maṇḍala and recited [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, one will become a vajra holder of all tathāgatas.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar phyag rgya chen po bcings la dkyil 'khor chen por 'dug ste /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar phyag rgya chen po bcings la dkyil 'khor chen por 'dug ste /
translated: Having bound the great seal in front of Vajrapāṇi, one should sit in the great maṇḍala.
