original: 'bum bzlas na sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas na sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, all obscurations are purified.

original: nyis 'bum bzlas na mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa thams cad ma lus par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyis 'bum bzlas na mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa thams cad ma lus par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats it two hundred thousand times, all misdeeds, such as the heinous crimes, are completely purified.

original: sum 'bum bzlas na bsod nams thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum 'bum bzlas na bsod nams thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats it three hundred thousand times, all merits manifest.

original: de nas dngos grub thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang / bshes gnyen thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dngos grub thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang / bshes gnyen thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, all accomplishments, all tathāgatas, and so forth, all perfections, and all spiritual friends manifest.

original: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcings te stong phrag brgya bzlas pa'i mjug tu mtshan thal byung bzlas na de'i nang par de @51b bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byon nas de'i snying gar zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcings te stong phrag brgya bzlas pa'i mjug tu mtshan thal byung bzlas na de'i nang par de @51b bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byon nas de'i snying gar zhugs te /
translated: Then, having formed the great seal, at the end of reciting one hundred thousand times, if one recites the essence mantra until dawn, all the Tathāgatas will arrive and enter into one’s heart.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'thob bo //
translated: Then one will attain the state of a Tathāgata.

original: yang na khar zhugs na spyan ras gzigs dbang po 'thob bo //
analyzed: yang na khar zhugs na spyan ras gzigs dbang po 'thob bo //
translated: Or, if they enter into one’s mouth, one will attain the state of Avalokiteśvara.

original: de nas ma bsgrubs kyang las su 'gyur ba ni dang po brjod pas bdag srung ngo //
analyzed: de nas ma bsgrubs kyang las su 'gyur ba ni dang po brjod pas bdag srung ngo //
translated: Then, even without accomplishment, one’s activities will be as follows: By reciting the mantra once, one protects oneself.

original: gnyis brjod pas ni gzhan dang / grong dang / grong khyer srung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis brjod pas ni gzhan dang / grong dang / grong khyer srung ngo //
translated: By reciting it twice, one protects others, villages, and cities.

original: gsum pa brjod pas ni las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: gsum pa brjod pas ni las thams cad byed do //
translated: By reciting it three times, one performs all activities.

original: dbab pa ni tsandan na gyi bdug pas so //
analyzed: dbab pa ni tsandan na gyi bdug pas so //
translated: For descent, use sandalwood incense.

original: gdon thams cad zhi bar bya ba ni hr'i zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: gdon thams cad zhi bar bya ba ni hr'i zhes bya bas so //
translated: For pacifying all spirits, use the mantra “Hari.”

original: sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba ni rdo rje me tog bzlas te byin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba ni rdo rje me tog bzlas te byin no //
translated: For magnetizing all sentient beings, recite the mantra of the vajra flower and give it to them.

original: sems can thams cad gnon pas ni sa ser pos so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gnon pas ni sa ser pos so //
translated: For subduing all sentient beings, use yellow earth.

original: bud med dbang du bya ba ni su ma n'a'i me tog la bsngags pas so //🔽chom rkun gnon pa ni yungs kar gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: bud med dbang du bya ba ni su ma n'a'i me tog la bsngags pas so // chom rkun gnon pa ni yungs kar gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: To enthrall a woman, recite [the mantra] over a jasmine flower.🔽 To suppress thieves, perform a homa with white mustard seeds.

original: ri dvags dang / bya gnon pa ni yungs kar gtor bas so //
analyzed: ri dvags dang / bya gnon pa ni yungs kar gtor bas so //
translated: To suppress wild animals and birds, scatter white mustard seeds.

original: sgyu ma gnon pa ni rma bya'i char bus so //
analyzed: sgyu ma gnon pa ni rma bya'i char bus so //
translated: To suppress illusions, use a peacock feather.

original: rmi lam mthong bar bya ba ni dus gsum du bzlas pas so //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong bar bya ba ni dus gsum du bzlas pas so //
translated: To see in dreams, recite [the mantra] three times.

original: rmi lam ngan pa gzhil pa ni til gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa gzhil pa ni til gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: To dispel bad dreams, perform a homa with sesame seeds.

original: sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba ni khyim bya'i sgro'i sbyin sreg gis so //🔽bu mo thor bu dbang du bya ba ni bu mo'i skra'i sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba ni khyim bya'i sgro'i sbyin sreg gis so // bu mo thor bu dbang du bya ba ni bu mo'i skra'i sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: To enthrall all beings, perform a homa with the feathers of a cock.🔽 To enthrall a single girl, perform a homa with her hair.

original: yugs sa mo dbang du bya ba ni bud med kyi me tog gi sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: yugs sa mo dbang du bya ba ni bud med kyi me tog gi sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: To enthrall a widow, perform a homa with a woman's flower.

original: bud med thams cad dbang du bya ba ni bud med kyi dbang po'i sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: bud med thams cad dbang du bya ba ni bud med kyi dbang po'i sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: To enthrall all women, perform a homa with a woman's organ.

original: @52a *// 'dod pa thams cad dbang du bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang po la mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: @52a *// 'dod pa thams cad dbang du bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang po la mchod pa byas nas /
translated: “The rite of enthralling all women: One should worship Lord Avalokiteśvara

original: nub gsum rangs par bzlas na de nas 'dod pa thams cad rtag tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nub gsum rangs par bzlas na de nas 'dod pa thams cad rtag tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and recite the mantra for three nights. Then one will always obtain all one’s desires.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i spyan sngar nyin re zhing dus gsum du lan gsum bzlas na /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i spyan sngar nyin re zhing dus gsum du lan gsum bzlas na /
translated: If one recites the mantra three times a day in front of Avalokiteśvara,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zla ba gsum gyis re ba ci 'dod pa'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zla ba gsum gyis re ba ci 'dod pa'i mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the Blessed One will grant whatever boon one desires within three months.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar zla ba gsum gyi bar du nyin mtshan gsum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pas mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar zla ba gsum gyi bar du nyin mtshan gsum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pas mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro // 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las /
translated: If one recites the mantra three times a day for three months in front of the Buddha, the Tathāgata will grant a boon.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i rtog pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the chapter on Avalokiteśvara, the twenty-first in the glorious Caṇḍa­mahā­roṣaṇa tantra called “The Sole Hero.”🔽Chapter

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the noble Ākāśagarbha Bodhisattva Mahāsattva said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis kyang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal por rang gi snying po 'bul gyi //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rtog pa chen po'i rgyal por rang gi snying po 'bul gyi //
translated: I too offer my own essence to the Great King of Manifestations, the Conqueror of the Three Worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes su gsol //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes su gsol //
translated: Please accept it, Blessed One.

original: 'dis sems can thams cad dbang bskur ba thob pa la sogs pa bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis sems can thams cad dbang bskur ba thob pa la sogs pa bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, all beings will attain the consecration and so forth, and all their wishes will be fulfilled.

original: de nas bcom ldan @52b 'das kyis 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' la skyes bu chen po smros shig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan @52b 'das kyis 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' la skyes bu chen po smros shig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the noble Ākāśagarbha Bodhisattva, Speak, great being.

original: de nas 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi snying po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi snying po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the noble Ākāśagarbha Bodhisattva Mahāsattva spoke his own essence:

original: tram p'a b'a ta ta ha ha /
analyzed: tram p'a b'a ta ta ha ha /
translated: Tram pāvāta tat haha.

original: de nas 'di brjod pas nam mkha' la dbang bskur ba thams cad la sogs pa rin po che'i rgyan thams cad dang / gos dang / gser dang / nor rin po che'i dbyig la sogs pa thams cad kyi char bab bo //
analyzed: de nas 'di brjod pas nam mkha' la dbang bskur ba thams cad la sogs pa rin po che'i rgyan thams cad dang / gos dang / gser dang / nor rin po che'i dbyig la sogs pa thams cad kyi char bab bo //
translated: Then, by reciting this, a rain of all ornaments of jewels, such as all the empowerments of space, clothes, gold, and precious wealth, falls.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku kun tu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku kun tu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te bzhugs so //
translated: The body of the Blessed One is adorned with all ornaments.

original: de nas nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpas dkyil 'khor chen po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpas dkyil 'khor chen po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then, the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha spoke this great maṇḍala:

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor tshul bzhin te //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor tshul bzhin te //
translated: The maṇḍala of vajra is as follows:

original: rdo rje rin chen mnyam ldan zhing //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen mnyam ldan zhing //
translated: Endowed with the vajra jewel,

original: grva brgyad shin tu mnyam par bya //
analyzed: grva brgyad shin tu mnyam par bya //
translated: the eight corners are perfectly equal,

original: rin chen kun dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: rin chen kun dang ldan par bya //
translated: and it is endowed with all jewels.

original: der slob dpon zhugs te rdo rje rin po che'i phyag rgya dbang bskur ba'i gnas su bzhag la zhugs nas 'di zhes brjod do //🔽re ba thams cad grub pa yi //
analyzed: der slob dpon zhugs te rdo rje rin po che'i phyag rgya dbang bskur ba'i gnas su bzhag la zhugs nas 'di zhes brjod do // re ba thams cad grub pa yi //
translated: The master enters there, places the vajra jewel mudrā in the place of empowerment, and having entered, recites this:🔽The accomplishment of space is the supreme accomplishment

original: nam mkha' grub pa mchog yin te //
analyzed: nam mkha' grub pa mchog yin te //
translated: of all hopes.

original: grub cig grub cig sems chen po //
analyzed: grub cig grub cig sems chen po //
translated: Accomplish, accomplish, great being!

original: bcom ldan thams cad grub par ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan thams cad grub par ro //
translated: May the Blessed One accomplish everything!

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' byin gyis rlob par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i snying po byang chub sems dpa' byin gyis rlob par mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One blesses the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su nam mkha'i snying po'i cha lugs bzhag la @53a *//
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su nam mkha'i snying po'i cha lugs bzhag la @53a *//
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala, one should place the form of Ākāśagarbha.

original: de'i thad 'khor kun tu phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa brgyad bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thad 'khor kun tu phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa brgyad bzhag par bya'o //
translated: All around it, in the surrounding area, one should place the eight holy beings beginning with Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas slob ma rdo rje khu tshur gyis gzhug go /
analyzed: de nas slob ma rdo rje khu tshur gyis gzhug go /
translated: Then, with the vajra fist, one should usher in the disciples.

original: bcug nas 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: bcug nas 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: After ushering them in, one should say this:🔽For the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,

original: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // bsam pa thams cad rdzogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // bsam pa thams cad rdzogs bya'i phyir //
translated: and for the sake of fulfilling all wishes,

original: don shes bstan pa gang yin te //
analyzed: don shes bstan pa gang yin te //
translated: the one who knows the meaning teaches

original: byang chub sems ni brtan pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni brtan pa yin //
translated: the firm mind of enlightenment.

original: de nas sbyin pa rnam pa bzhi bslab bo //
analyzed: de nas sbyin pa rnam pa bzhi bslab bo //
translated: Then one should train in the four types of generosity:

original: de la dbang bskur ba sbyin pa dang / nor sbyin pa dang / zas sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang bskur ba sbyin pa dang / nor sbyin pa dang / zas sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: the generosity of empowerment, the generosity of wealth, the generosity of food, and the generosity of Dharma.

original: de la dbang bskur ba sbyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la dbang bskur ba sbyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la'o //
translated: The bestowal of empowerment is for the tathāgatas.

original: nor sbyin  pa ni sems can thams cad la'o //
analyzed: nor sbyin  pa ni sems can thams cad la'o //
translated: The bestowal of wealth is for all sentient beings.

original: zas sbyin pa ni byol song thams cad la'o //
analyzed: zas sbyin pa ni byol song thams cad la'o //
translated: The bestowal of food is for all animals.

original: chos sbyin pa ni sems can mi snang ba thams cad la'o //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa ni sems can mi snang ba thams cad la'o //
translated: The bestowal of the Dharma is for all invisible sentient beings.

original: de nas snying po byin la /
analyzed: de nas snying po byin la /
translated: Then, having given the essence,

original: rin po che thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bum pa'i chus dbang bskur te 'di zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rin po che thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bum pa'i chus dbang bskur te 'di zhes brjod do //
translated: empower with the water of the vase consecrated with all jewels and say this:

original: aom badzra ratn'a bhi shi k'a bhi shinytsa sarba dhi pa ti h'um b'a b'a ta ta ha ha //
analyzed: aom badzra ratn'a bhi shi k'a bhi shinytsa sarba dhi pa ti h'um b'a b'a ta ta ha ha //
translated: Oṃ vajra ratnābhiṣiñcābhaḥ sarva-dhīpati hūṃ bhavāvat tāṃ ha ha.

original: de nas rdo rje nor bu'i khu tshur gyis phyag rgya bslab ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje nor bu'i khu tshur gyis phyag rgya bslab ste /
translated: Then, train in the mudra with the vajra-jewel fist.

original: sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra is this:

original: h'um b'a ta ha /
analyzed: h'um b'a ta ha /
translated: Hūṃ bhavāvat tāṃ.

original: de nas rdo rje rin po che'i phyag rgya bcings te sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rin po che'i phyag rgya bcings te sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: Then, bind the vajra-jewel mudra and the mantra is this:

original: aom b'a b'a ta mu bam/
analyzed: aom b'a b'a ta mu bam/
translated: Oṃ bhavāvat muṃ.

original: de nas mchod pa rnam bzhi bya ste 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas mchod pa rnam bzhi bya ste 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, perform the four offerings.

original: dbang thams cad bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dbang thams cad bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The maṇḍala for bestowing all empowerments.

original: de nas rdo rje rin po che'i dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rin po che'i dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /
translated: Then the maṇḍala of the vajra gem arises.

original: rdo rje rin po che dbus su bris la @53b lag tu nor bu thogs nas rdo rje rin po che langs kyi bar du bzlas so //
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che dbus su bris la @53b lag tu nor bu thogs nas rdo rje rin po che langs kyi bar du bzlas so //
translated: Having drawn a vajra gem in the middle, holding a jewel in one’s hand, one should recite until the vajra gem arises.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa byon te dbang bskur bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa byon te dbang bskur bar mdzad do //
translated: Then the Tathāgata arrives and confers empowerment.

original: dbang bskur ba des na thams cad kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba des na thams cad kyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: By that empowerment, one becomes the lord of all.

original: rin po che'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rin po che'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of the gem.

original: de nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Then the maṇḍala of the pledge:

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i cha lugs bris la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i cha lugs bris la /
translated: Having drawn the form of Ākāśagarbha,

original: spyan sngar nor dang / gser dang / mu tig dang / nor bu rin po che la sogs pa gang yang rung ba bzhag la de nas de btsud de thams cad bstan nas /
analyzed: spyan sngar nor dang / gser dang / mu tig dang / nor bu rin po che la sogs pa gang yang rung ba bzhag la de nas de btsud de thams cad bstan nas /
translated: one should place in front of him whatever is suitable, such as wealth, gold, pearls, jewels, and gems, and then, having caused him to enter, one should show everything.

original: dam tshig 'di sbyin no //🔽sangs rgyas la sogs sems dpa' dag /
analyzed: dam tshig 'di sbyin no // sangs rgyas la sogs sems dpa' dag /
translated: This is the pledge to be given:🔽“If you do not make offerings to the buddhas and so forth

original: gal te nyin re mchod stongs na //
analyzed: gal te nyin re mchod stongs na //
translated: and to the heroes every day,

original: khyod kyis nor dang don bsags pa //
analyzed: khyod kyis nor dang don bsags pa //
translated: the wealth and benefits you have accumulated

original: tshe rabs kun tu 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe rabs kun tu 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: will be destroyed in all your lives.”

original: de la 'di ni mna'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni mna'i snying po'o //
translated: This is the essence of the vow: Om, I will do it!

original: aom b'a b'a ta ta ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom b'a b'a ta ta ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Om, I will do it!

original: de nas chus dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de nas chus dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, confer the empowerment with water:

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the pledge mandala.

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor bris la de bzhin gshegs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor bris la de bzhin gshegs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya ste /
translated: Draw the action mandala and adorn it with all the ornaments of the tathagatas.

original: de'i dbus su bzhag nas der btsud de /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bzhag nas der btsud de /
translated: Place the disciple in the center of that and induct him.

original: de nas las rnam pa lnga bslab pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas las rnam pa lnga bslab pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, train in the five actions:

original: dbang sbyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang sbyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by giving empowerment, one should make offerings to all tathagatas.

original: de nas nor sbyin pa ni dge sbyong dang / bram ze la sogs pa la ci nus kyis sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas nor sbyin pa ni dge sbyong dang / bram ze la sogs pa la ci nus kyis sbyin no //
translated: Then, giving wealth is giving to shramanas, brahmins, and so forth according to one's ability.

original: de nas zas sbyin pa ni byol song rnams la sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas zas sbyin pa ni byol song rnams la sbyin no //
translated: Then, giving food is giving to animals.

original: de nas mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni gyod khrid thams cad la sbyin no //🔽de nas chos sbyin pa ni mi snang @54a *//
analyzed: de nas mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni gyod khrid thams cad la sbyin no // de nas chos sbyin pa ni mi snang @54a *//
translated: Then, giving protection is giving to all those who are in danger.

original: ba'i sems can rnams la sbyin no //
analyzed: ba'i sems can rnams la sbyin no //
translated: Then, giving Dharma is giving to invisible sentient beings.

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The action mandala.

original: de nas bsgrub pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas bsgrub pa 'byung ste /

original: lag pa g-yon pas rdo rje khu tshur bcing te stong phrag brgya bzlas na /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas rdo rje khu tshur bcing te stong phrag brgya bzlas na /
translated: If one binds the vajra-fist with the left hand and repeats it one hundred thousand times,

original: khu tshur bcings pa des mi snang bar 'gyur te phral na snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu tshur bcings pa des mi snang bar 'gyur te phral na snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by binding the fist, one will become invisible, and if one opens it, one will become visible again.

original: rdo rje bcings pa'i khu tshur byas la 'bum bzlas na khu tshur bcangs pas bcing ba dang / rengs par bya ba dang / gnyid log par bya ba thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje bcings pa'i khu tshur byas la 'bum bzlas na khu tshur bcangs pas bcing ba dang / rengs par bya ba dang / gnyid log par bya ba thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a hundred thousand repetitions with the vajra-fist gesture, one will be able to paralyze, stupefy, and put to sleep all those who are bound by the vajra-fist gesture.

original: nam mkha' la rdo rje khu tshur bcangs te 'bum bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur byabs pa tsam gyis nam mkha' la nor dang / gser dang / mu ting dang / rgyan dang / rin po che dang / gos dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' la rdo rje khu tshur bcangs te 'bum bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur byabs pa tsam gyis nam mkha' la nor dang / gser dang / mu ting dang / rgyan dang / rin po che dang / gos dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang /
translated: If one makes a hundred thousand repetitions in the sky with the vajra-fist gesture, by merely brandishing the vajra fist in the sky, one will be able to summon whatever one wishes: wealth, gold, pearls, ornaments, jewels, clothes, food, drink,

original: me dang / chu dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / myu gu dang / yi ge dang / 'thab @59b cha dang / ston skyobs dang / mtshon cha dang / glegs bam dang / rtog pa dang / mdo sde dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa dngos po gnas pa dang /
analyzed: me dang / chu dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / myu gu dang / yi ge dang / 'thab @59b cha dang / ston skyobs dang / mtshon cha dang / glegs bam dang / rtog pa dang / mdo sde dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa dngos po gnas pa dang /
translated: fire, water, flowers, fruits, sprouts, letters, battles, harvests, weapons, books, treatises, sūtras, images of the Buddha, and so forth.

original: 'gro ba ci 'dod pa dgug par byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ci 'dod pa dgug par byed do //
translated: One will be able to summon whatever one wishes.

original: g-yas pa rdo rje khu tshur bcangs la 'bum bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur bstan pas gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dgug pa dang / 'dren pa dang / 'gyel bar nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yas pa rdo rje khu tshur bcangs la 'bum bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur bstan pas gnas pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dgug pa dang / 'dren pa dang / 'gyel bar nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times while holding the vajra fist with the right hand, then by showing the vajra fist one will be able to paralyze, summon, lead, and cause to fall all beings.

original: khu tshur bsgyur bas thams cad gtan 'pho nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu tshur bsgyur bas thams cad gtan 'pho nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By changing the fist, one will be able to cause all to tremble.

original: g-yas pas rdo rje khu tshur bcings la stong phrag brgya bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur byabs pas thams cad las nor dang / gser dang / rgyan dang / gos dang / mtshon cha dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos po thams cad dgug /
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje khu tshur bcings la stong phrag brgya bzlas na rdo rje khu tshur byabs pas thams cad las nor dang / gser dang / rgyan dang / gos dang / mtshon cha dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos po thams cad dgug /
translated: If one recites the mantra one thousand times while holding the vajra fist with the right hand, then by brandishing the vajra fist one will be able to summon all wealth, gold, ornaments, clothes, weapons, flowers, fruits, and so forth, as well as all things.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya las dam pa thams cad kyang dgug go /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya las dam pa thams cad kyang dgug go /
translated: One will also be able to summon all excellent forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures.

original: bud med kyi nu ma dang / mngal phyogs dang / mig dang / sna dang / mchu dang / rna ba dang / mgo dang / brla dang / ska rags dang / gsang spu la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyang dgug go /
analyzed: bud med kyi nu ma dang / mngal phyogs dang / mig dang / sna dang / mchu dang / rna ba dang / mgo dang / brla dang / ska rags dang / gsang spu la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyang dgug go /
translated: One can also summon all things, such as a woman’s breasts, her vagina, her eyes, nose, lips, ears, head, thighs, belt, pubic hair, and so forth.

original: bkrol na thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bkrol na thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one releases them, they will be freed.

original: nyin zhag gcig smyungs la lag pa gnyis rdo rje khu tshur bcangs te /
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig smyungs la lag pa gnyis rdo rje khu tshur bcangs te /
translated: “One should fast for a day and night, and make one’s two hands into vajra fists.

original: stong phrag brgya bzlas na de phyin chad khu tshur bcangs pas las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: stong phrag brgya bzlas na de phyin chad khu tshur bcangs pas las thams cad byed do //
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred thousand times, from then on one will be able to perform all activities with one’s hands in a fist.

original: de la las rnams ni dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / @60a *//
analyzed: de la las rnams ni dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / @60a *//
translated: The activities are summoning, inducting, binding,

original: dbang du bya ba dang / rengs par bya ba dang / rmugs par bya ba dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / bslang ba dang / drang ba dang / bsgyel pa dang / brdangs pa dang / bskrad pa dang / dbye ba dang /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba dang / rengs par bya ba dang / rmugs par bya ba dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / bslang ba dang / drang ba dang / bsgyel pa dang / brdangs pa dang / bskrad pa dang / dbye ba dang /
translated: enslaving, paralyzing, stupefying, sealing, putting to sleep, waking up, drawing, toppling, laughing, driving away, separating,

original: go bzlog pa dang / gtan 'pho ba dang / gso ba dang / sgyu ma thams cad bstan pa dang / dus tshigs bsgyur ba dang / sa la sogs pa g-yo ba dang / thams cad la dbab pa dang / dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang /🔽gar byed pa dang / glu len pa dang / sngon ma byung ba'i sbyor ba dang / so sor lung ston pa dang / 'khrul 'khor thams cad gzhom pa dang / sgo thams cad dbye ba dang / gdon thams cad 'jug pa dang / dug thams cad bslang ba dang /
analyzed: go bzlog pa dang / gtan 'pho ba dang / gso ba dang / sgyu ma thams cad bstan pa dang / dus tshigs bsgyur ba dang / sa la sogs pa g-yo ba dang / thams cad la dbab pa dang / dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang / gar byed pa dang / glu len pa dang / sngon ma byung ba'i sbyor ba dang / so sor lung ston pa dang / 'khrul 'khor thams cad gzhom pa dang / sgo thams cad dbye ba dang / gdon thams cad 'jug pa dang / dug thams cad bslang ba dang /
translated: reversing,🔽transference, healing, teaching all illusions, changing the seasons, moving earth and so forth, bringing down all, and entering the maṇḍala.🔽Dancing, singing, the practice of the previously unknown, individual prophecy, destroying all machines, opening all doors, entering all spirits, extracting all poisons,

original: ma rungs par bya ba dang / thams cad spo ba dang / thams cad kyi phyag rgya gzhom pa dang / thams cad 'gags pa dang / gas pa sbyar ba dang / sbrul bskrad pa dang / gzung ba dang / gtang ba dang / ser ba dang /
analyzed: ma rungs par bya ba dang / thams cad spo ba dang / thams cad kyi phyag rgya gzhom pa dang / thams cad 'gags pa dang / gas pa sbyar ba dang / sbrul bskrad pa dang / gzung ba dang / gtang ba dang / ser ba dang /
translated: making unappealing, transferring all, destroying all seals, stopping all, applying cracks, expelling snakes, holding, releasing, hail,

original: char dbab pa dang / glog dbyung ba dang / thams cad slar bcad pa dang / sngon chad med pa'i gos dang / rgyan dang / rin po che dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / bya dang /
analyzed: char dbab pa dang / glog dbyung ba dang / thams cad slar bcad pa dang / sngon chad med pa'i gos dang / rgyan dang / rin po che dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / bya dang /
translated: causing rain to fall, causing lightning to strike, causing everything to be destroyed, causing the appearance of previously non-existent clothes, ornaments, jewels, flowers, fruits, men, women, birds,

original: ri dvags dgug pa dang / gtong ba dang / gzugs mang po ston pa dang / mi snang ba dang / nam @60b mkha' la 'gro ba bstan pa la sogs pa 'dod pa bzhin las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri dvags dgug pa dang / gtong ba dang / gzugs mang po ston pa dang / mi snang ba dang / nam @60b mkha' la 'gro ba bstan pa la sogs pa 'dod pa bzhin las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and deer, summoning, dismissing, displaying many forms, becoming invisible, flying through the sky, and so forth.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las /
translated: From the Great King of Manifestations, Victorious Over the Three Worlds,

original: rdo rje khu tshur gyi rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyi rtog pa'o ////
translated: the manifestation of Vajra Fist.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa byang chub sems dpas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa byang chub sems dpas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the youthful Manjushri Bodhisattva said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: bdag gis kyang rang gi snying po 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa 'dir stsal bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rang gi snying po 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa 'dir stsal bar bgyi ste /
translated: I too will bestow my essence, this contemplation that is victorious in the three worlds.

original: gang brjod pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzod brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang brjod pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzod brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely uttering it, the treasury of all the tathāgatas will be expressed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: khyod kyis smros shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis smros shig ces gsungs so //
translated: speak!”

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas smras pa /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said:

original: aa ra pa tsa na /
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na /
translated: “Arapacana.

original: de nas 'di brjod ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid las yi ge mnyam pa nyid sems can thams cad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grub pa thob par 'gyur ba bshad do //
analyzed: de nas 'di brjod ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid las yi ge mnyam pa nyid sems can thams cad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grub pa thob par 'gyur ba bshad do //
translated: As soon as this was uttered, all the tathāgatas explained the equality of all phenomena, the equality of syllables, and the attainment of the perfection of wisdom by all sentient beings.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /🔽'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes bcu bzhi'am /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor 'byung ste / 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes bcu bzhi'am /
translated: Then the maṇḍala arises.

original: bco lnga la bris te /
analyzed: bco lnga la bris te /
translated: The maṇḍala of the wheel is drawn on the waxing fourteenth or fifteenth day.

original: de'i dbus kyi lte bar 'jam dpal bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte bar 'jam dpal bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, Mañjuśrī should be placed.

original: rdo rje ral gri dang / glegs bam thogs par byas @61a *//
analyzed: rdo rje ral gri dang / glegs bam thogs par byas @61a *//
translated: He should be made to hold a vajra, a sword, and a book.

original: la / de'i thad 'khor thams cad du yi ge aa ra pa tsa na la sogs pa'i phreng ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: la / de'i thad 'khor thams cad du yi ge aa ra pa tsa na la sogs pa'i phreng ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: In all the surrounding space, the garland of the letters of the Aparājita mantra should be written.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis rdo rje ral gri dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis rdo rje ral gri dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la zhugs te /
translated: Then the master, having formed the pledge seal of the vajra sword, should enter.

original: ni shtha panydza ga zhes bya ba'i yi ge 'di brjod do //
analyzed: ni shtha panydza ga zhes bya ba'i yi ge 'di brjod do //
translated: He should utter this syllable: niḥsthapanyaṅka.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis slob dpon la thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa yang stsol te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis slob dpon la thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa yang stsol te /
translated: Then the Blessed One also grants to the master unimpeded eloquence.

original: de phyin chad bcom ldan 'das kyis nam mkha' la yi ger bris te thams cad gsung ngo //
analyzed: de phyin chad bcom ldan 'das kyis nam mkha' la yi ger bris te thams cad gsung ngo //
translated: From then on, the Blessed One writes in the sky with his letters and all speak.

original: de bzhin du slob ma bcug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du slob ma bcug ste /
translated: In the same way, the disciple should be made to enter.

original: 'di zhes smros shig /
analyzed: 'di zhes smros shig /
translated: He should say this:

original: deng khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: deng khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Today you will attain the Dharma of the Tathāgatas.

original: snying po 'di khyod kyis su la yang ma smra zhig /
analyzed: snying po 'di khyod kyis su la yang ma smra zhig /
translated: Do not speak this essence to anyone.”

original: de la gsang ba'i yi ge 'di rnams so //
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i yi ge 'di rnams so //
translated: These are the secret syllables.

original: aa ra pa tsa na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called arapaṭa-na,

original: 'dod pa thams cad thob bo //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad thob bo //
translated: which means all desires are obtained.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: aa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The syllable a means desire.

original: ra zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: ra zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
translated: The syllable ra means attachment.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The syllable pa means ultimate.

original: tsa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tsa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa'o //
translated: The syllable ṭa means conduct.

original: na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The syllable na means essencelessness.

original: de ltar 'dod pa dang / chags pa dang / don dam pa dang / spyod pa dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi snying po 'di bsgoms te bsgrubs na 'dod pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa dang / chags pa dang / don dam pa dang / spyod pa dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi snying po 'di bsgoms te bsgrubs na 'dod pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one meditates on and accomplishes this essence of desire, attachment, ultimate, conduct, and essencelessness, all desires will be obtained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dod pa thams cad kyi snod yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dod pa thams cad kyi snod yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is the vessel of all desires.

original: de bas na snying po 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin kyang myur du thob @61b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na snying po 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin kyang myur du thob @61b par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by this essence, one will quickly attain the Tathāgata and the Vajra Holder.

original: de nas phyag rgya bcing ba bslab po //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya bcing ba bslab po //
translated: Then, one should train in binding the mudrā,

original: spros pa med pa'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: which is called supreme without elaboration.

original: de nas ral gri'i dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas ral gri'i dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /
translated: Then the sword maṇḍala arises.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje dkyil 'khor bris la de'i dbus su ral gri bzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje dkyil 'khor bris la de'i dbus su ral gri bzhag ste /
translated: Thus, having drawn the vajra maṇḍala, place the sword in its center.

original: mdun du snying po 'di bsgrubs na /
analyzed: mdun du snying po 'di bsgrubs na /
translated: If one accomplishes this essence in front,

original: des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one accomplishes Mañjuśrī the Youth.

original: rdo rje ral gri'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ral gri'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of the vajra sword.

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor chen po tshul bzhin du bris la zhugs nas 'di zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor chen po tshul bzhin du bris la zhugs nas 'di zhes brjod do //
translated: The maṇḍala of the pledge is drawn in the manner of the great maṇḍala. Having entered, one should say this:

original: aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharma n'am/🔽a'a d+ya nu tpa nna tva ta /
analyzed: aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharma n'am/ a'a d+ya nu tpa nna tva ta /
translated: “A kāro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇām,🔽ādyanutpannatvāt.

original: aa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes nang par langs nas nyin re lan re brjod na mtshams med pa thams cad kyis mi gos so //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes nang par langs nas nyin re lan re brjod na mtshams med pa thams cad kyis mi gos so //
translated: “A” is the door of all dharmas, because they are primordially unarisen. If one recites this once each day after rising in the morning, one will not be tainted by any of the heinous actions.

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of the pledge.

original: de nas las kyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas las kyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ste /
translated: Then the maṇḍala of activity arises.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bzhag nas mchod pa rnam pa bzhis mchod pa ni 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / sgom pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bzhag nas mchod pa rnam pa bzhis mchod pa ni 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / sgom pas so //
translated: Having placed the perfection of wisdom in the center of the maṇḍala, one should worship with the four types of worship, namely, writing, reading, reciting, and meditating.

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of activity.

original: de nas bsgrub par 'dod pas dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du ras la bris nas /
analyzed: de nas bsgrub par 'dod pas dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du ras la bris nas /
translated: Then, one who wishes to practice should draw on cloth in the manner of the great maṇḍala.

original: yi ge phreng ba thams cad brjod de 'di skad du chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi bsgrub pa'o zhes kyang brjod nas yi ge 'di 'bum bzlas na spobs pa mi zad par 'jam dpal dang mtshungs pa dang / @62a *//
analyzed: yi ge phreng ba thams cad brjod de 'di skad du chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi bsgrub pa'o zhes kyang brjod nas yi ge 'di 'bum bzlas na spobs pa mi zad par 'jam dpal dang mtshungs pa dang / @62a *//
translated: Having recited all the strings of syllables and stated, “All phenomena are established by nature,” if one recites this syllable one hundred thousand times, one will become equal to Mañjuśrī, with inexhaustible eloquence,

original: nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and one will be able to travel through space.

original: de nas ma bsgrubs kyang las su 'gyur ba ni lan gcig bzlas pas sdug bsngal thams cad las grol lo //
analyzed: de nas ma bsgrubs kyang las su 'gyur ba ni lan gcig bzlas pas sdug bsngal thams cad las grol lo //
translated: Then, even without practice, the activity is that by reciting it once, one will be freed from all suffering.

original: gnyis bzlas pas mtshams med pa thams cad lhag ma ma lus par zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis bzlas pas mtshams med pa thams cad lhag ma ma lus par zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it twice, all the heinous actions will be completely exhausted.

original: gsum bzlas pas ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum bzlas pas ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it three times, one will manifest samādhi.

original: bzhi bzlas pas dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi bzlas pas dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it four times, one will become mindful.

original: lnga bzlas pas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po las /

analyzed: rig pa'i blon po chen po'i rtog pa'o ////

analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'khyil pa la sogs pa rdo rje khro bos 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po 'dir rang gi snying po phul ba; aom aa mri ta ku nda li kha kha kha kha krodha dzva l'a m'a la h'um
